1.verse: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the wicked,

2.verse: But his delight is in the law of Jehovah;

3.verse: And he shall be like a tree planted by the streams of water,

4.verse: The wicked are not so,

5.verse: Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgment,

6.verse: For Jehovah knoweth the way of the righteous;

1.verse: Why do the nations rage,

2.verse: The kings of the earth set themselves,

3.verse: Let us break their bonds asunder,

4.verse: He that sitteth in the heavens will laugh:

5.verse: Then will he speak unto them in his wrath,

6.verse: Yet I have set my king

7.verse: I will tell of the decree:

8.verse: Ask of me, and I will give thee the nations for thine inheritance,

9.verse: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron;

10.verse: Now therefore be wise, O ye kings:

11.verse: Serve Jehovah with fear,

12.verse: Kiss the son, lest he be angry, and ye perish in the way,

1.verse: Jehovah, how are mine adversaries increased!

2.verse: Many there are that say of my soul,

3.verse: But thou, O Jehovah, art a shield about me;

4.verse: I cry unto Jehovah with my voice,

5.verse: I laid me down and slept;

6.verse: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of the people

7.verse: Arise, O Jehovah; save me, O my God:

8.verse: Salvation belongeth unto Jehovah:

1.verse: Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness;

2.verse: O ye sons of men, how long shall my glory be turned into dishonor?

3.verse: But know that Jehovah hath set apart for himself him that is godly:

4.verse: Stand in awe, and sin not:

5.verse: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness,

6.verse: Many there are that say, Who will show us any good?

7.verse: Thou hast put gladness in my heart,

8.verse: In peace will I both lay me down and sleep;

1.verse: Give ear to my words, O Jehovah,

2.verse: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God;

3.verse: O Jehovah, in the morning shalt thou hear my voice;

4.verse: For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness:

5.verse: The arrogant shall not stand in thy sight:

6.verse: Thou wilt destroy them that speak lies:

7.verse: But as for me, in the abundance of thy lovingkindness will I come into thy house:

8.verse: Lead me, O Jehovah, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies;

9.verse: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth;

10.verse: Hold them guilty, O God;

11.verse: But let all those that take refuge in thee rejoice,

12.verse: For thou wilt bless the righteous;

1.verse: O Jehovah, rebuke me not in thine anger,

2.verse: Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah; for I am withered away:

3.verse: My soul also is sore troubled:

4.verse: Return, O Jehovah, deliver my soul:

5.verse: For in death there is no remembrance of thee:

6.verse: I am weary with my groaning;

7.verse: Mine eye wasteth away because of grief;

8.verse: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity;

9.verse: Jehovah hath heard my supplication;

10.verse: All mine enemies shall be put to shame and sore troubled:

1.verse: O Jehovah my God, in thee do I take refuge:

2.verse: Lest they tear my soul like a lion,

3.verse: O Jehovah my God, if I have done this;

4.verse: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me

5.verse: Let the enemy pursue my soul, and overtake it;

6.verse: Arise, O Jehovah, in thine anger;

7.verse: And let the congregation of the peoples compass thee about;

8.verse: Jehovah ministereth judgment to the peoples:

9.verse: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, but establish thou the righteous:

10.verse: My shield is with God,

11.verse: God is a righteous judge,

12.verse: If a man turn not, he will whet his sword;

13.verse: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death;

14.verse: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity;

15.verse: He hath made a pit, and digged it,

16.verse: His mischief shall return upon his own head,

17.verse: I will give thanks unto Jehovah according to his righteousness,

1.verse: O Jehovah, our Lord, How excellent is thy name in all the earth,

2.verse: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou established strength,

3.verse: When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers,

4.verse: What is man, that thou art mindful of him?

5.verse: For thou hast made him but little lower than God,

6.verse: Thou makest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands;

7.verse: All sheep and oxen,

8.verse: The birds of the heavens, and the fish of the sea,

9.verse: O Jehovah, our Lord,

1.verse: I will give thanks unto Jehovah with my whole heart;

2.verse: I will be glad and exult in thee;

3.verse: When mine enemies turn back,

4.verse: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause;

5.verse: Thou hast rebuked the nations, thou hast destroyed the wicked;

6.verse: The enemy are come to an end, they are desolate for ever;

7.verse: But Jehovah sitteth as king for ever:

8.verse: And he will judge the world in righteousness,

9.verse: Jehovah also will be a high tower for the oppressed,

10.verse: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee;

11.verse: Sing praises to Jehovah, who dwelleth in Zion:

12.verse: For he that maketh inquisition for blood remembereth them;

13.verse: Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah;

14.verse: That I may show forth all thy praise.

15.verse: The nations are sunk down in the pit that they made:

16.verse: Jehovah hath made himself known, he hath executed judgment:

17.verse: The wicked shall be turned back unto Sheol,

18.verse: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten,

19.verse: Arise, O Jehovah; let not man prevail:

20.verse: Put them in fear, O Jehovah:

1.verse: Why standest thou afar off, O Jehovah?

2.verse: In the pride of the wicked the poor is hotly pursued;

3.verse: For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire,

4.verse: The wicked, in the pride of his countenance, saith , He will not require it .

5.verse: His ways are firm at all times;

6.verse: He saith in his heart, I shall not be moved;

7.verse: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and oppression:

8.verse: He sitteth in the lurking-places of the villages;

9.verse: He lurketh in secret as a lion in his covert;

10.verse: He croucheth, he boweth down,

11.verse: He saith in his heart: God hath forgotten;

12.verse: Arise, O Jehovah; O God, lift up thy hand:

13.verse: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God,

14.verse: Thou hast seen it ; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand:

15.verse: Break thou the arm of the wicked;

16.verse: Jehovah is King for ever and ever:

17.verse: Jehovah, thou hast heard the desire of the meek:

18.verse: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed,

1.verse: In Jehovah do I take refuge:

2.verse: For, lo, the wicked bend the bow,

3.verse: If the foundations be destroyed,

4.verse: Jehovah is in his holy temple;

5.verse: Jehovah trieth the righteous;

6.verse: Upon the wicked he will rain snares;

7.verse: For Jehovah is righteous; he loveth righteousness:

1.verse: Help, Jehovah; for the godly man ceaseth;

2.verse: They speak falsehood every one with his neighbor:

3.verse: Jehovah will cut off all flattering lips,

4.verse: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail;

5.verse: Because of the oppression of the poor, because of the sighing of the needy,

6.verse: The words of Jehovah are pure words;

7.verse: Thou wilt keep them, O Jehovah,

8.verse: The wicked walk on every side,

1.verse: How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou forget me for ever?

2.verse: How long shall I take counsel in my soul,

3.verse: Consider and answer me, O Jehovah my God:

4.verse: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him;

5.verse: But I have trusted in thy lovingkindness;

6.verse: I will sing unto Jehovah,

1.verse: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God.

2.verse: Jehovah looked down from heaven upon the children of men,

3.verse: They are all gone aside; they are together become filthy;

4.verse: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge,

5.verse: There were they in great fear;

6.verse: Ye put to shame the counsel of the poor,

7.verse: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion!

1.verse: Jehovah, who shall sojourn in thy tabernacle?

2.verse: He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness,

3.verse: He that slandereth not with his tongue,

4.verse: In whose eyes a reprobate is despised,

5.verse: He that putteth not out his money to interest,

1.verse: Preserve me, O God; for in thee do I take refuge.

2.verse: O my soul , thou hast said unto Jehovah, Thou art my Lord:

3.verse: As for the saints that are in the earth,

4.verse: Their sorrows shall be multiplied that give gifts for another god :

5.verse: Jehovah is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup:

6.verse: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places;

7.verse: I will bless Jehovah, who hath given me counsel;

8.verse: I have set Jehovah always before me:

9.verse: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth:

10.verse: For thou wilt not leave my soul to Sheol;

11.verse: Thou wilt show me the path of life:

1.verse: Hear the right, O Jehovah, attend unto my cry;

2.verse: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence;

3.verse: Thou hast proved my heart; thou hast visited me in the night;

4.verse: As for the works of men, by the word of thy lips

5.verse: My steps have held fast to thy paths,

6.verse: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt answer me, O God:

7.verse: Show thy marvellous lovingkindness,

8.verse: Keep me as the apple of the eye;

9.verse: From the wicked that oppress me,

10.verse: They are inclosed in their own fat:

11.verse: They have now compassed us in our steps;

12.verse: He is like a lion that is greedy of his prey,

13.verse: Arise, O Jehovah,

14.verse: From men by thy hand, O Jehovah,

15.verse: As for me, I shall behold thy face in righteousness;

1.verse: I love thee, O Jehovah, my strength.

2.verse: Jehovah is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer;

3.verse: I will call upon Jehovah, who is worthy to be praised:

4.verse: The cords of death compassed me,

5.verse: The cords of Sheol were round about me;

6.verse: In my distress I called upon Jehovah,

7.verse: Then the earth shook and trembled;

8.verse: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils,

9.verse: He bowed the heavens also, and came down;

10.verse: And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly;

11.verse: He made darkness his hiding-place, his pavilion round about him,

12.verse: At the brightness before him his thick clouds passed,

13.verse: Jehovah also thundered in the heavens,

14.verse: And he sent out his arrows, and scattered them;

15.verse: Then the channels of waters appeared,

16.verse: He sent from on high, he took me;

17.verse: He delivered me from my strong enemy,

18.verse: They came upon me in the day of my calamity;

19.verse: He brought me forth also into a large place;

20.verse: Jehovah hath rewarded me according to my righteousness;

21.verse: For I have kept the ways of Jehovah,

22.verse: For all his ordinances were before me,

23.verse: I was also perfect with him,

24.verse: Therefore hath Jehovah recompensed me according to my righteousness,

25.verse: With the merciful thou wilt show thyself merciful;

26.verse: With the pure thou wilt show thyself pure;

27.verse: For thou wilt save the afflicted people;

28.verse: For thou wilt light my lamp:

29.verse: For by thee I run upon a troop;

30.verse: As for God, his way is perfect:

31.verse: For who is God, save Jehovah?

32.verse: The God that girdeth me with strength,

33.verse: He maketh my feet like hinds’ feet :

34.verse: He teacheth my hands to war;

35.verse: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation;

36.verse: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me,

37.verse: I will pursue mine enemies, and overtake them;

38.verse: I will smite them through, so that they shall not be able to rise:

39.verse: For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle:

40.verse: Thou hast also made mine enemies turn their backs unto me,

41.verse: They cried, but there was none to save;

42.verse: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind;

43.verse: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people;

44.verse: As soon as they hear of me they shall obey me;

46.verse: Jehovah liveth; and blessed be my rock;

47.verse: Even the God that executeth vengeance for me,

48.verse: He rescueth me from mine enemies;

49.verse: Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah, among the nations,

50.verse: Great deliverance giveth he to his king,

1.verse: The heavens declare the glory of God;

2.verse: Day unto day uttereth speech,

3.verse: There is no speech nor language;

4.verse: Their line is gone out through all the earth,

5.verse: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber,

6.verse: His going forth is from the end of the heavens,

7.verse: The law of Jehovah is perfect, restoring the soul:

8.verse: The precepts of Jehovah are right, rejoicing the heart:

9.verse: The fear of Jehovah is clean, enduring for ever:

10.verse: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold;

11.verse: Moreover by them is thy servant warned:

12.verse: Who can discern his errors?

13.verse: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins ;

14.verse: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart

1.verse: Jehovah answer thee in the day of trouble;

2.verse: Send thee help from the sanctuary,

3.verse: Remember all thy offerings,

4.verse: Grant thee thy heart’s desire,

5.verse: We will triumph in thy salvation,

6.verse: Now know I that Jehovah saveth his anointed;

7.verse: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses;

8.verse: They are bowed down and fallen;

9.verse: Save, Jehovah:

1.verse: The king shall joy in thy strength, O Jehovah;

2.verse: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire,

3.verse: For thou meetest him with the blessings of goodness:

4.verse: He asked life of thee, thou gavest it him,

5.verse: His glory is great in thy salvation:

6.verse: For thou makest him most blessed for ever:

7.verse: For the king trusteth in Jehovah;

8.verse: Thy hand will find out all thine enemies;

9.verse: Thou wilt make them as a fiery furnace in the time of thine anger:

10.verse: Their fruit wilt thou destroy from the earth,

11.verse: For they intended evil against thee;

12.verse: For thou wilt make them turn their back;

13.verse: Be thou exalted, O Jehovah, in thy strength:

1.verse: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

2.verse: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou answerest not;

3.verse: But thou art holy,

4.verse: Our fathers trusted in thee:

5.verse: They cried unto thee, and were delivered:

6.verse: But I am a worm, and no man;

7.verse: All they that see me laugh me to scorn:

8.verse: Commit thyself unto Jehovah; let him deliver him:

9.verse: But thou art he that took me out of the womb;

10.verse: I was cast upon thee from the womb;

11.verse: Be not far from me; for trouble is near;

12.verse: Many bulls have compassed me;

13.verse: They gape upon me with their mouth,

14.verse: I am poured out like water,

15.verse: My strength is dried up like a potsherd;

16.verse: For dogs have compassed me:

17.verse: I may count all my bones.

18.verse: They part my garments among them,

19.verse: But be not thou far off, O Jehovah:

20.verse: Deliver my soul from the sword,

21.verse: Save me from the lion’s mouth;

22.verse: I will declare thy name unto my brethren:

23.verse: Ye that fear Jehovah, praise him;

24.verse: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted;

25.verse: Of thee cometh my praise in the great assembly:

26.verse: The meek shall eat and be satisfied;

27.verse: All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn unto Jehovah;

29.verse: All the fat ones of the earth shall eat and worship:

31.verse: They shall come and shall declare his righteousness

1.verse: Jehovah is my shepherd; I shall not want.

2.verse: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures;

3.verse: He restoreth my soul:

4.verse: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,

5.verse: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies:

6.verse: Surely goodness and lovingkindness shall follow me all the days of my life;

1.verse: The earth is Jehovah’s, and the fulness thereof;

2.verse: For he hath founded it upon the seas,

3.verse: Who shall ascend into the hill of Jehovah?

4.verse: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart;

5.verse: He shall receive a blessing from Jehovah,

6.verse: This is the generation of them that seek after him,

7.verse: Lift up your heads, O ye gates;

8.verse: Who is the King of glory?

9.verse: Lift up your heads, O ye gates;

10.verse: Who is this King of glory?

1.verse: Unto thee, O Jehovah, do I lift up my soul.

2.verse: O my God, in thee have I trusted,

3.verse: Yea, none that wait for thee shall be put to shame:

4.verse: Show me thy ways, O Jehovah;

5.verse: Guide me in thy truth, and teach me;

6.verse: Remember, O Jehovah, thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindness;

7.verse: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions:

8.verse: Good and upright is Jehovah:

9.verse: The meek will he guide in justice;

10.verse: All the paths of Jehovah are lovingkindness and truth

11.verse: For thy name’s sake, O Jehovah,

12.verse: What man is he that feareth Jehovah?

13.verse: His soul shall dwell at ease;

14.verse: The friendship of Jehovah is with them that fear him;

15.verse: Mine eyes are ever toward Jehovah;

16.verse: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me;

17.verse: The troubles of my heart are enlarged:

18.verse: Consider mine affliction and my travail;

19.verse: Consider mine enemies, for they are many;

20.verse: Oh keep my soul, and deliver me:

21.verse: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me,

22.verse: Redeem Israel, O God,

1.verse: Judge me, O Jehovah, for I have walked in mine integrity:

2.verse: Examine me, O Jehovah, and prove me;

3.verse: For thy lovingkindness is before mine eyes;

4.verse: I have not sat with men of falsehood;

5.verse: I hate the assembly of evil-doers,

6.verse: I will wash my hands in innocency:

7.verse: That I may make the voice of thanksgiving to be heard,

8.verse: Jehovah, I love the habitation of thy house,

9.verse: Gather not my soul with sinners,

10.verse: In whose hands is wickedness,

11.verse: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity:

12.verse: My foot standeth in an even place:

1.verse: Jehovah is my light and my salvation;

2.verse: When evil-doers came upon me to eat up my flesh,

3.verse: Though a host should encamp against me,

4.verse: One thing have I asked of Jehovah, that will I seek after:

5.verse: For in the day of trouble he will keep me secretly in his pavilion:

6.verse: And now shall my head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me;

7.verse: Hear, O Jehovah, when I cry with my voice:

8.verse: When thou saidst , Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee,

9.verse: Hide not thy face from me;

10.verse: When my father and my mother forsake me,

11.verse: Teach me thy way, O Jehovah;

12.verse: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine adversaries:

13.verse: I had fainted , unless I had believed to see the goodness of Jehovah

14.verse: Wait for Jehovah:

1.verse: Unto thee, O Jehovah, will I call:

2.verse: Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee,

3.verse: Draw me not away with the wicked,

4.verse: Give them according to their work, and according to the wickedness of their doings:

5.verse: Because they regard not the works of Jehovah,

6.verse: Blessed be Jehovah,

7.verse: Jehovah is my strength and my shield;

8.verse: Jehovah is their strength,

9.verse: Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance:

1.verse: Ascribe unto Jehovah, O ye sons of the mighty,

2.verse: Ascribe unto Jehovah the glory due unto his name;

3.verse: The voice of Jehovah is upon the waters:

4.verse: The voice of Jehovah is powerful;

5.verse: The voice of Jehovah breaketh the cedars;

6.verse: He maketh them also to skip like a calf;

7.verse: The voice of Jehovah cleaveth the flames of fire.

8.verse: The voice of Jehovah shaketh the wilderness;

9.verse: The voice of Jehovah maketh the hinds to calve,

10.verse: Jehovah sat as King at the Flood;

11.verse: Jehovah will give strength unto his people;

1.verse: I will extol thee, O Jehovah; for thou hast raised me up,

2.verse: O Jehovah my God,

3.verse: O Jehovah, thou hast brought up my soul from Sheol;

4.verse: Sing praise unto Jehovah, O ye saints of his,

5.verse: For his anger is but for a moment;

6.verse: As for me, I said in my prosperity,

7.verse: Thou, Jehovah, of thy favor hadst made my mountain to stand strong:

8.verse: I cried to thee, O Jehovah;

9.verse: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit?

10.verse: Hear, O Jehovah, and have mercy upon me:

11.verse: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing;

12.verse: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent.

1.verse: In thee, O Jehovah, do I take refuge;

2.verse: Bow down thine ear unto me; deliver me speedily:

3.verse: For thou art my rock and my fortress;

4.verse: Pluck me out of the net that they have laid privily for me;

5.verse: Into thy hand I commend my spirit:

6.verse: I hate them that regard lying vanities;

7.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in thy lovingkindness;

8.verse: And thou hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy;

9.verse: Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah, for I am in distress:

10.verse: For my life is spent with sorrow,

11.verse: Because of all mine adversaries I am become a reproach,

12.verse: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind:

13.verse: For I have heard the defaming of many,

14.verse: But I trusted in thee, O Jehovah:

15.verse: My times are in thy hand:

16.verse: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant:

17.verse: Let me not be put to shame, O Jehovah; for I have called upon thee:

18.verse: Let the lying lips be dumb,

19.verse: Oh how great is thy goodness,

20.verse: In the covert of thy presence wilt thou hide them from the plottings of man:

21.verse: Blessed be Jehovah;

22.verse: As for me, I said in my haste,

23.verse: Oh love Jehovah, all ye his saints:

24.verse: Be strong, and let your heart take courage,

1.verse: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven,

2.verse: Blessed is the man unto whom Jehovah imputeth not iniquity,

3.verse: When I kept silence, my bones wasted away

4.verse: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me:

5.verse: I acknowledged my sin unto thee,

6.verse: For this let every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found:

7.verse: Thou art my hiding-place; thou wilt preserve me from trouble;

8.verse: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go:

9.verse: Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding;

10.verse: Many sorrows shall be to the wicked;

11.verse: Be glad in Jehovah, and rejoice, ye righteous;

1.verse: Rejoice in Jehovah, O ye righteous:

2.verse: Give thanks unto Jehovah with the harp:

3.verse: Sing unto him a new song;

4.verse: For the word of Jehovah is right;

5.verse: He loveth righteousness and justice:

6.verse: By the word of Jehovah were the heavens made,

7.verse: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as a heap:

8.verse: Let all the earth fear Jehovah:

9.verse: For he spake, and it was done;

10.verse: Jehovah bringeth the counsel of the nations to nought;

11.verse: The counsel of Jehovah standeth fast for ever,

12.verse: Blessed is the nation whose God is Jehovah,

13.verse: Jehovah looketh from heaven;

14.verse: From the place of his habitation he looketh forth

15.verse: He that fashioneth the hearts of them all,

16.verse: There is no king saved by the multitude of a host:

17.verse: A horse is a vain thing for safety;

18.verse: Behold, the eye of Jehovah is upon them that fear him,

19.verse: To deliver their soul from death,

20.verse: Our soul hath waited for Jehovah:

21.verse: For our heart shall rejoice in him,

22.verse: Let thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah, be upon us,

1.verse: I will bless Jehovah at all times:

2.verse: My soul shall make her boast in Jehovah:

3.verse: Oh magnify Jehovah with me,

4.verse: I sought Jehovah, and he answered me,

5.verse: They looked unto him, and were radiant;

6.verse: This poor man cried, and Jehovah heard him,

7.verse: The angel of Jehovah encampeth round about them that fear him,

8.verse: Oh taste and see that Jehovah is good:

9.verse: Oh fear Jehovah, ye his saints;

10.verse: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger;

11.verse: Come, ye children, hearken unto me:

12.verse: What man is he that desireth life,

13.verse: Keep thy tongue from evil,

14.verse: Depart from evil, and do good;

15.verse: The eyes of Jehovah are toward the righteous,

16.verse: The face of Jehovah is against them that do evil,

17.verse: The righteous cried, and Jehovah heard,

18.verse: Jehovah is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart,

19.verse: Many are the afflictions of the righteous;

20.verse: He keepeth all his bones:

21.verse: Evil shall slay the wicked;

22.verse: Jehovah redeemeth the soul of his servants;

1.verse: Strive thou, O Jehovah, with them that strive with me:

2.verse: Take hold of shield and buckler,

3.verse: Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that pursue me:

4.verse: Let them be put to shame and brought to dishonor that seek after my soul:

5.verse: Let them be as chaff before the wind,

6.verse: Let their way be dark and slippery,

7.verse: For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit;

8.verse: Let destruction come upon him unawares;

9.verse: And my soul shall be joyful in Jehovah:

10.verse: All my bones shall say, Jehovah, who is like unto thee,

11.verse: Unrighteous witnesses rise up;

12.verse: They reward me evil for good,

13.verse: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth:

14.verse: I behaved myself as though it had been my friend or my brother:

15.verse: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together:

16.verse: Like the profane mockers in feasts,

17.verse: Lord, how long wilt thou look on?

18.verse: I will give thee thanks in the great assembly:

19.verse: Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me;

20.verse: For they speak not peace;

21.verse: Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me;

22.verse: Thou hast seen it, O Jehovah; keep not silence:

23.verse: Stir up thyself, and awake to the justice due unto me,

24.verse: Judge me, O Jehovah my God, according to thy righteousness;

25.verse: Let them not say in their heart, Aha, so would we have it:

26.verse: Let them be put to shame and confounded together that rejoice at my hurt:

27.verse: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favor my righteous cause:

28.verse: And my tongue shall talk of thy righteousness

1.verse: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart,

2.verse: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes,

3.verse: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit:

4.verse: He deviseth iniquity upon his bed;

5.verse: Thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah, is in the heavens;

6.verse: Thy righteousness is like the mountains of God;

7.verse: How precious is thy lovingkindness, O God!

8.verse: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house;

9.verse: For with thee is the fountain of life:

10.verse: Oh continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee,

11.verse: Let not the foot of pride come against me,

12.verse: There are the workers of iniquity fallen:

1.verse: Fret not thyself because of evil-doers,

2.verse: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass,

3.verse: Trust in Jehovah, and do good;

4.verse: Delight thyself also in Jehovah;

5.verse: Commit thy way unto Jehovah;

6.verse: And he will make thy righteousness to go forth as the light,

7.verse: Rest in Jehovah, and wait patiently for him:

8.verse: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath:

9.verse: For evil-doers shall be cut off;

10.verse: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be:

11.verse: But the meek shall inherit the land,

12.verse: The wicked plotteth against the just,

13.verse: The Lord will laugh at him;

14.verse: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow,

15.verse: Their sword shall enter into their own heart,

16.verse: Better is a little that the righteous hath

17.verse: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken;

18.verse: Jehovah knoweth the days of the perfect;

19.verse: They shall not be put to shame in the time of evil;

20.verse: But the wicked shall perish,

21.verse: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again;

22.verse: For such as are blessed of him shall inherit the land;

23.verse: A man’s goings are established of Jehovah;

24.verse: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down;

25.verse: I have been young, and now am old;

26.verse: All the day long he dealeth graciously, and lendeth;

27.verse: Depart from evil, and do good;

29.verse: The righteous shall inherit the land,

30.verse: The mouth of the righteous talketh of wisdom,

31.verse: The law of his God is in his heart;

33.verse: Jehovah will not leave him in his hand,

34.verse: Wait for Jehovah, and keep his way,

35.verse: I have seen the wicked in great power,

36.verse: But one passed by, and, lo, he was not:

37.verse: Mark the perfect man, and behold the upright;

38.verse: As for transgressors, they shall be destroyed together:

39.verse: But the salvation of the righteous is of Jehovah:

40.verse: And Jehovah helpeth them, and rescueth them:

1.verse: O Jehovah, rebuke me not in thy wrath;

2.verse: For thine arrows stick fast in me,

3.verse: There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine indignation;

4.verse: For mine iniquities are gone over my head:

5.verse: My wounds are loathsome and corrupt,

6.verse: I am pained and bowed down greatly;

7.verse: For my loins are filled with burning;

8.verse: I am faint and sore bruised:

9.verse: Lord, all my desire is before thee;

10.verse: My heart throbbeth, my strength faileth me:

11.verse: My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my plague;

12.verse: They also that seek after my life lay snares for me ;

13.verse: But I, as a deaf man, hear not;

14.verse: Yea, I am as a man that heareth not,

15.verse: For in thee, O Jehovah, do I hope:

16.verse: For I said, Lest they rejoice over me:

17.verse: For I am ready to fall,

18.verse: For I will declare mine iniquity;

19.verse: But mine enemies are lively, and are strong;

20.verse: They also that render evil for good

21.verse: Forsake me not, O Jehovah:

22.verse: Make haste to help me,

1.verse: I said, I will take heed to my ways,

2.verse: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good;

3.verse: My heart was hot within me;

4.verse: Jehovah, make me to know mine end,

5.verse: Behold, thou hast made my days as handbreadths;

6.verse: Surely every man walketh in a vain show;

7.verse: And now, Lord, what wait I for?

8.verse: Deliver me from all my transgressions:

9.verse: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth;

10.verse: Remove thy stroke away from me:

11.verse: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity,

12.verse: Hear my prayer, O Jehovah, and give ear unto my cry;

13.verse: Oh spare me, that I may recover strength,

1.verse: I waited patiently for Jehovah;

2.verse: He brought me up also out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay;

3.verse: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God:

4.verse: Blessed is the man that maketh Jehovah his trust,

5.verse: Many, O Jehovah my God, are the wonderful works which thou hast done,

6.verse: Sacrifice and offering thou hast no delight in;

7.verse: Then said I, Lo, I am come;

8.verse: I delight to do thy will, O my God;

9.verse: I have proclaimed glad tidings of righteousness in the great assembly;

10.verse: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart;

11.verse: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Jehovah;

12.verse: For innumerable evils have compassed me about;

13.verse: Be pleased, O Jehovah, to deliver me:

14.verse: Let them be put to shame and confounded together

15.verse: Let them be desolate by reason of their shame

16.verse: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee:

17.verse: But I am poor and needy;

1.verse: Blessed is he that considereth the poor:

2.verse: Jehovah will preserve him, and keep him alive,

3.verse: Jehovah will support him upon the couch of languishing:

4.verse: I said, O Jehovah, have mercy upon me:

5.verse: Mine enemies speak evil against me, saying ,

6.verse: And if he come to see me , he speaketh falsehood;

7.verse: All that hate me whisper together against me;

8.verse: An evil disease, say they , cleaveth fast unto him;

9.verse: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted,

10.verse: But thou, O Jehovah, have mercy upon me, and raise me up,

11.verse: By this I know that thou delightest in me,

12.verse: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity,

13.verse: Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel,

1.verse: As the hart panteth after the water brooks,

2.verse: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God:

3.verse: My tears have been my food day and night,

4.verse: These things I remember, and pour out my soul within me,

5.verse: Why art thou cast down, O my soul?

6.verse: O my God, my soul is cast down within me:

7.verse: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterfalls:

8.verse: Yet Jehovah will command his lovingkindness in the day-time;

9.verse: I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me?

10.verse: As with a sword in my bones, mine adversaries reproach me,

11.verse: Why art thou cast down, O my soul?

1.verse: Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation:

2.verse: For thou art the God of my strength; why hast thou cast me off?

3.verse: Oh send out thy light and thy truth; let them lead me:

4.verse: Then will I go unto the altar of God,

5.verse: Why art thou cast down, O my soul?

1.verse: We have heard with our ears, O God,

2.verse: Thou didst drive out the nations with thy hand;

3.verse: For they gat not the land in possession by their own sword,

4.verse: Thou art my King, O God:

5.verse: Through thee will we push down our adversaries:

6.verse: For I will not trust in my bow,

7.verse: But thou hast saved us from our adversaries,

8.verse: In God have we made our boast all the day long,

9.verse: But now thou hast cast us off, and brought us to dishonor,

10.verse: Thou makest us to turn back from the adversary;

11.verse: Thou hast made us like sheep appointed for food,

12.verse: Thou sellest thy people for nought,

13.verse: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbors,

14.verse: Thou makest us a byword among the nations,

15.verse: All the day long is my dishonor before me,

16.verse: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth,

17.verse: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee,

18.verse: Our heart is not turned back,

19.verse: That thou hast sore broken us in the place of jackals,

20.verse: If we have forgotten the name of our God,

21.verse: Will not God search this out?

22.verse: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long;

23.verse: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord?

24.verse: Wherefore hidest thou thy face,

25.verse: For our soul is bowed down to the dust:

1.verse: My heart overfloweth with a goodly matter;

2.verse: Thou art fairer than the children of men;

3.verse: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O mighty one,

4.verse: And in thy majesty ride on prosperously,

5.verse: Thine arrows are sharp;

6.verse: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever:

7.verse: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated wickedness:

8.verse: All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia;

9.verse: Kings’ daughters are among thy honorable women:

10.verse: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear;

11.verse: So will the king desire thy beauty;

12.verse: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift;

13.verse: The king’s daughter within the palace is all glorious:

14.verse: She shall be led unto the king in broidered work:

15.verse: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be led:

16.verse: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children,

17.verse: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations:

1.verse: God is our refuge and strength,

2.verse: Therefore will we not fear, though the earth do change,

3.verse: Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled,

4.verse: There is a river, the streams whereof make glad the city of God,

5.verse: God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved:

6.verse: The nations raged, the kingdoms were moved:

7.verse: Jehovah of hosts is with us;

8.verse: Come, behold the works of Jehovah,

9.verse: He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth;

10.verse: Be still, and know that I am God:

11.verse: Jehovah of hosts is with us;

1.verse: Oh clap your hands, all ye peoples;

2.verse: For Jehovah Most High is terrible;

3.verse: He subdueth peoples under us,

4.verse: He chooseth our inheritance for us,

5.verse: God is gone up with a shout,

6.verse: Sing praises to God, sing praises:

7.verse: For God is the King of all the earth:

8.verse: God reigneth over the nations:

9.verse: The princes of the peoples are gathered together

1.verse: Great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised,

2.verse: Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,

3.verse: God hath made himself known in her palaces for a refuge.

4.verse: For, lo, the kings assembled themselves,

5.verse: They saw it, then were they amazed;

6.verse: Trembling took hold of them there,

7.verse: With the east wind

8.verse: As we have heard, so have we seen

9.verse: We have thought on thy lovingkindness, O God,

10.verse: As is thy name, O God,

11.verse: Let mount Zion be glad,

12.verse: Walk about Zion, and go round about her;

13.verse: Mark ye well her bulwarks;

14.verse: For this God is our God for ever and ever:

1.verse: Hear this, all ye peoples;

2.verse: Both low and high,

3.verse: My mouth shall speak wisdom;

4.verse: I will incline mine ear to a parable:

5.verse: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil,

6.verse: They that trust in their wealth,

7.verse: None of them can by any means redeem his brother,

8.verse: (For the redemption of their life is costly,

9.verse: That he should still live alway,

10.verse: For he shall see it. Wise men die;

11.verse: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever,

12.verse: But man being in honor abideth not:

13.verse: This their way is their folly:

14.verse: They are appointed as a flock for Sheol;

15.verse: But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol;

16.verse: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich,

17.verse: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away;

18.verse: Though while he lived he blessed his soul

19.verse: He shall go to the generation of his fathers;

20.verse: Man that is in honor, and understandeth not,

1.verse: The Mighty One, God, Jehovah, hath spoken,

2.verse: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,

3.verse: Our God cometh, and doth not keep silence:

4.verse: He calleth to the heavens above,

5.verse: Gather my saints together unto me,

6.verse: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness;

7.verse: Hear, O my people, and I will speak;

8.verse: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices;

9.verse: I will take no bullock out of thy house,

10.verse: For every beast of the forest is mine,

11.verse: I know all the birds of the mountains;

12.verse: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee;

13.verse: Will I eat the flesh of bulls,

14.verse: Offer unto God the sacrifice of thanksgiving;

15.verse: And call upon me in the day of trouble:

16.verse: But unto the wicked God saith,

17.verse: Seeing that thou hatest instruction,

18.verse: When thou sawest a thief, thou consentedst with him,

19.verse: Thou givest thy mouth to evil,

20.verse: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother;

21.verse: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence;

22.verse: Now consider this, ye that forget God,

23.verse: Whoso offereth the sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifieth me;

1.verse: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness:

2.verse: Wash me thoroughly from mine iniquity,

3.verse: For I know my transgressions;

4.verse: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned,

5.verse: Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity;

6.verse: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts;

7.verse: Purify me with hyssop, and I shall be clean:

8.verse: Make me to hear joy and gladness,

9.verse: Hide thy face from my sins,

10.verse: Create in me a clean heart, O God;

11.verse: Cast me not away from thy presence;

12.verse: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation;

13.verse: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways;

14.verse: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation;

15.verse: O Lord, open thou my lips;

16.verse: For thou delightest not in sacrifice; else would I give it:

17.verse: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit:

18.verse: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion:

19.verse: Then wilt thou delight in the sacrifices of righteousness,

1.verse: Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man?

2.verse: Thy tongue deviseth very wickedness,

3.verse: Thou lovest evil more than good,

4.verse: Thou lovest all devouring words,

5.verse: God will likewise destroy thee for ever;

6.verse: The righteous also shall see it , and fear,

7.verse: Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength,

8.verse: But as for me, I am like a green olive-tree in the house of God:

9.verse: I will give thee thanks for ever, because thou hast done it;

1.verse: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God.

2.verse: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men,

3.verse: Every one of them is gone back; they are together become filthy;

4.verse: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge,

5.verse: There were they in great fear, where no fear was;

6.verse: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion!

1.verse: Save me, O God, by thy name,

2.verse: Hear my prayer, O God;

3.verse: For strangers are risen up against me,

4.verse: Behold, God is my helper:

5.verse: He will requite the evil unto mine enemies:

6.verse: With a freewill-offering will I sacrifice unto thee:

7.verse: For he hath delivered me out of all trouble;

1.verse: Give ear to my prayer, O God;

2.verse: Attend unto me, and answer me:

3.verse: Because of the voice of the enemy,

4.verse: My heart is sore pained within me:

5.verse: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me,

6.verse: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove!

7.verse: Lo, then would I wander far off,

8.verse: I would haste me to a shelter

9.verse: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongue;

10.verse: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof:

11.verse: Wickedness is in the midst thereof:

12.verse: For it was not an enemy that reproached me;

13.verse: But it was thou, a man mine equal,

14.verse: We took sweet counsel together;

15.verse: Let death come suddenly upon them,

16.verse: As for me, I will call upon God;

17.verse: Evening, and morning, and at noonday, will I complain, and moan;

18.verse: He hath redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me;

19.verse: God will hear, and answer them,

20.verse: He hath put forth his hands against such as were at peace with him:

21.verse: His mouth was smooth as butter,

22.verse: Cast thy burden upon Jehovah, and he will sustain thee:

23.verse: But thou, O God, wilt bring them down into the pit of destruction:

1.verse: Be merciful unto me, O God; for man would swallow me up:

2.verse: Mine enemies would swallow me up all the day long;

3.verse: What time I am afraid,

4.verse: In God (I will praise his word),

5.verse: All the day long they wrest my words:

6.verse: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves,

7.verse: Shall they escape by iniquity?

8.verse: Thou numberest my wanderings:

9.verse: Then shall mine enemies turn back in the day that I call:

10.verse: In God (I will praise his word),

11.verse: In God have I put my trust, I will not be afraid;

12.verse: Thy vows are upon me, O God:

13.verse: For thou hast delivered my soul from death:

1.verse: Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me;

2.verse: I will cry unto God Most High,

3.verse: He will send from heaven, and save me,

4.verse: My soul is among lions;

5.verse: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens;

6.verse: They have prepared a net for my steps;

7.verse: My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed:

8.verse: Awake up, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp:

9.verse: I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the peoples:

10.verse: For thy lovingkindness is great unto the heavens,

11.verse: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens;

1.verse: Do ye indeed in silence speak righteousness?

2.verse: Nay, in heart ye work wickedness;

3.verse: The wicked are estranged from the womb:

4.verse: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent:

5.verse: Which hearkeneth not to the voice of charmers,

6.verse: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth:

7.verse: Let them melt away as water that runneth apace:

8.verse: Let them be as a snail which melteth and passeth away,

9.verse: Before your pots can feel the thorns,

10.verse: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance:

11.verse: So that men shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous:

1.verse: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God:

2.verse: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity,

3.verse: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul;

4.verse: They run and prepare themselves without my fault:

5.verse: Even thou, O Jehovah God of hosts, the God of Israel,

6.verse: They return at evening, they howl like a dog,

7.verse: Behold, they belch out with their mouth;

8.verse: But thou, O Jehovah, wilt laugh at them;

9.verse: Because of his strength I will give heed unto thee;

10.verse: My God with his lovingkindness will meet me:

11.verse: Slay them not, lest my people forget:

12.verse: For the sin of their mouth, and the words of their lips,

13.verse: Consume them in wrath, consume them, so that they shall be no more:

14.verse: And at evening let them return, let them howl like a dog,

15.verse: They shall wander up and down for food,

16.verse: But I will sing of thy strength;

17.verse: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing praises:

1.verse: O God thou hast cast us off, thou hast broken us down;

2.verse: Thou hast made the land to tremble; thou hast rent it:

3.verse: Thou hast showed thy people hard things:

4.verse: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee,

5.verse: That thy beloved may be delivered,

6.verse: God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult;

7.verse: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;

8.verse: Moab is my washpot;

9.verse: Who will bring me into the strong city?

10.verse: Hast not thou, O God, cast us off?

11.verse: Give us help against the adversary;

12.verse: Through God we shall do valiantly;

1.verse: Hear my cry, O God;

2.verse: From the end of the earth will I call unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed:

3.verse: For thou hast been a refuge for me,

4.verse: I will dwell in thy tabernacle for ever:

5.verse: For thou, O God, hast heard my vows:

6.verse: Thou wilt prolong the king’s life;

7.verse: He shall abide before God for ever:

8.verse: So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever,

1.verse: My soul waiteth in silence for God only:

2.verse: He only is my rock and my salvation:

3.verse: How long will ye set upon a man,

4.verse: They only consult to thrust him down from his dignity;

5.verse: My soul, wait thou in silence for God only;

6.verse: He only is my rock and my salvation:

7.verse: With God is my salvation and my glory:

8.verse: Trust in him at all times, ye people;

9.verse: Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie:

10.verse: Trust not in oppression,

11.verse: God hath spoken once,

12.verse: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth lovingkindness;

1.verse: O God, thou art my God; earnestly will I seek thee:

2.verse: So have I looked upon thee in the sanctuary,

3.verse: Because thy lovingkindness is better than life,

4.verse: So will I bless thee while I live:

5.verse: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness;

6.verse: When I remember thee upon my bed,

7.verse: For thou hast been my help,

8.verse: My soul followeth hard after thee:

9.verse: But those that seek my soul, to destroy it,

10.verse: They shall be given over to the power of the sword:

11.verse: But the king shall rejoice in God:

1.verse: Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint:

2.verse: Hide me from the secret counsel of evil-doers,

3.verse: Who have whet their tongue like a sword,

4.verse: That they may shoot in secret places at the perfect:

5.verse: They encourage themselves in an evil purpose;

6.verse: They search out iniquities;

7.verse: But God will shoot at them;

8.verse: So they shall be made to stumble, their own tongue being against them:

9.verse: And all men shall fear;

10.verse: The righteous shall be glad in Jehovah, and shall take refuge in him;

1.verse: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Zion;

2.verse: O thou that hearest prayer,

3.verse: Iniquities prevail against me:

4.verse: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee ,

5.verse: By terrible things thou wilt answer us in righteousness,

6.verse: Who by his strength setteth fast the mountains,

7.verse: Who stilleth the roaring of the seas,

8.verse: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens:

9.verse: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it,

10.verse: Thou waterest its furrows abundantly;

11.verse: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness;

12.verse: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness;

13.verse: The pastures are clothed with flocks;

1.verse: Make a joyful noise unto God, all the earth:

2.verse: Sing forth the glory of his name:

3.verse: Say unto God, How terrible are thy works!

4.verse: All the earth shall worship thee,

5.verse: Come, and see the works of God;

6.verse: He turned the sea into dry land;

7.verse: He ruleth by his might for ever;

8.verse: Oh bless our God, ye peoples,

9.verse: Who holdeth our soul in life,

10.verse: For thou, O God, hast proved us:

11.verse: Thou broughtest us into the net;

12.verse: Thou didst cause men to ride over our heads;

13.verse: I will come into thy house with burnt-offerings;

14.verse: Which my lips uttered,

15.verse: I will offer unto thee burnt-offerings of fatlings,

16.verse: Come, and hear, all ye that fear God,

17.verse: I cried unto him with my mouth,

18.verse: If I regard iniquity in my heart,

19.verse: But verily God hath heard;

20.verse: Blessed be God,

1.verse: God be merciful unto us, and bless us,

2.verse: That thy way may be known upon earth,

3.verse: Let the peoples praise thee, O God;

4.verse: Oh let the nations be glad and sing for joy;

5.verse: Let the peoples praise thee, O God;

6.verse: The earth hath yielded its increase:

7.verse: God will bless us;

1.verse: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered;

2.verse: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away:

3.verse: But let the righteous be glad; let them exult before God:

4.verse: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name:

5.verse: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows,

6.verse: God setteth the solitary in families:

7.verse: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people,

8.verse: The earth trembled,

9.verse: Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain,

10.verse: Thy congregation dwelt therein:

11.verse: The Lord giveth the word:

12.verse: Kings of armies flee, they flee;

13.verse: When ye lie among the sheepfolds,

14.verse: When the Almighty scattered kings therein,

15.verse: A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan;

16.verse: Why look ye askance, ye high mountains,

17.verse: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands upon thousands:

18.verse: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led away captives;

19.verse: Blessed be the Lord, who daily beareth our burden,

20.verse: God is unto us a God of deliverances;

21.verse: But God will smite through the head of his enemies,

22.verse: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan,

23.verse: That thou mayest crush them , dipping thy foot in blood,

24.verse: They have seen thy goings, O God,

25.verse: The singers went before, the minstrels followed after,

26.verse: Bless ye God in the congregations,

27.verse: There is little Benjamin their ruler,

28.verse: Thy God hath commanded thy strength:

29.verse: Because of thy temple at Jerusalem

30.verse: Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds,

31.verse: Princes shall come out of Egypt;

32.verse: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth;

33.verse: To him that rideth upon the heaven of heavens, which are of old;

35.verse: O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places:

1.verse: Save me, O God;

2.verse: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing:

3.verse: I am weary with my crying; my throat is dried:

4.verse: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head:

5.verse: O God, thou knowest my foolishness;

6.verse: Let not them that wait for thee be put to shame through me, O Lord Jehovah of hosts:

7.verse: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach;

8.verse: I am become a stranger unto my brethren,

9.verse: For the zeal of thy house hath eaten me up;

10.verse: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting,

11.verse: When I made sackcloth my clothing,

12.verse: They that sit in the gate talk of me;

13.verse: But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O Jehovah, in an acceptable time:

14.verse: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink:

15.verse: Let not the waterflood overwhelm me,

16.verse: Answer me, O Jehovah; for thy lovingkindness is good:

17.verse: And hide not thy face from thy servant;

18.verse: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it:

19.verse: Thou knowest my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonor:

20.verse: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness:

21.verse: They gave me also gall for my food;

22.verse: Let their table before them become a snare;

23.verse: Let their eyes be darkened, so that they cannot see;

24.verse: Pour out thine indignation upon them,

26.verse: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten;

28.verse: Let them be blotted out of the book of life,

29.verse: But I am poor and sorrowful:

30.verse: I will praise the name of God with a song,

31.verse: And it will please Jehovah better than an ox,

32.verse: The meek have seen it, and are glad:

34.verse: Let heaven and earth praise him,

35.verse: For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah;

36.verse: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it;

1.verse: Make haste , O God, to deliver me;

2.verse: Let them be put to shame and confounded

3.verse: Let them be turned back by reason of their shame

4.verse: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee;

5.verse: But I am poor and needy;

1.verse: In thee, O Jehovah, do I take refuge:

2.verse: Deliver me in thy righteousness, and rescue me:

3.verse: Be thou to me a rock of habitation, whereunto I may continually resort:

4.verse: Rescue me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked,

5.verse: For thou art my hope, O Lord Jehovah:

6.verse: By thee have I been holden up from the womb;

7.verse: I am as a wonder unto many;

8.verse: My mouth shall be filled with thy praise,

9.verse: Cast me not off in the time of old age;

10.verse: For mine enemies speak concerning me;

11.verse: Saying, God hath forsaken him:

12.verse: O God, be not far from me;

13.verse: Let them be put to shame and consumed that are adversaries to my soul;

14.verse: But I will hope continually,

15.verse: My mouth shall tell of thy righteousness,

16.verse: I will come with the mighty acts of the Lord Jehovah:

17.verse: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth;

18.verse: Yea, even when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not,

19.verse: Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high;

20.verse: Thou, who hast showed us many and sore troubles,

21.verse: Increase thou my greatness,

22.verse: I will also praise thee with the psaltery,

23.verse: My lips shall shout for joy when I sing praises unto thee;

24.verse: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long;

1.verse: Give the king thy judgments, O God,

2.verse: He will judge thy people with righteousness,

3.verse: The mountains shall bring peace to the people,

4.verse: He will judge the poor of the people,

5.verse: They shall fear thee while the sun endureth,

6.verse: He will come down like rain upon the mown grass,

7.verse: In his days shall the righteous flourish,

8.verse: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea,

9.verse: They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him;

10.verse: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall render tribute:

11.verse: Yea, all kings shall fall down before him;

12.verse: For he will deliver the needy when he crieth,

13.verse: He will have pity on the poor and needy,

14.verse: He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence;

15.verse: And they shall live; and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba:

16.verse: There shall be abundance of grain in the earth upon the top of the mountains;

17.verse: His name shall endure for ever;

18.verse: Blessed be Jehovah God, the God of Israel,

19.verse: And blessed be his glorious name for ever;

20.verse: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.

1.verse: Surely God is good to Israel,

2.verse: But as for me, my feet were almost gone;

3.verse: For I was envious at the arrogant,

4.verse: For there are no pangs in their death;

5.verse: They are not in trouble as other men;

6.verse: Therefore pride is as a chain about their neck;

7.verse: Their eyes stand out with fatness:

8.verse: They scoff, and in wickedness utter oppression:

9.verse: They have set their mouth in the heavens,

10.verse: Therefore his people return hither:

11.verse: And they say, How doth God know?

12.verse: Behold, these are the wicked;

13.verse: Surely in vain have I cleansed my heart,

14.verse: For all the day long have I been plagued,

15.verse: If I had said, I will speak thus;

16.verse: When I thought how I might know this,

17.verse: Until I went into the sanctuary of God,

18.verse: Surely thou settest them in slippery places:

19.verse: How are they become a desolation in a moment!

20.verse: As a dream when one awaketh,

21.verse: For my soul was grieved,

22.verse: So brutish was I, and ignorant;

23.verse: Nevertheless I am continually with thee:

24.verse: Thou wilt guide me with thy counsel,

25.verse: Whom have I in heaven but thee ?

26.verse: My flesh and my heart faileth;

27.verse: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish:

28.verse: But it is good for me to draw near unto God:

1.verse: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever?

2.verse: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast gotten of old,

3.verse: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual ruins,

4.verse: Thine adversaries have roared in the midst of thine assembly;

5.verse: They seemed as men that lifted up

6.verse: And now all the carved work thereof

7.verse: They have set thy sanctuary on fire;

8.verse: They said in their heart, Let us make havoc of them altogether:

9.verse: We see not our signs:

10.verse: How long, O God, shall the adversary reproach?

11.verse: Why drawest thou back thy hand, even thy right hand?

12.verse: Yet God is my King of old,

13.verse: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength:

14.verse: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces;

15.verse: Thou didst cleave fountain and flood:

16.verse: The day is thine, the night also is thine:

17.verse: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth:

18.verse: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O Jehovah,

19.verse: Oh deliver not the soul of thy turtle-dove unto the wild beast:

20.verse: Have respect unto the covenant;

21.verse: Oh let not the oppressed return ashamed:

22.verse: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause:

23.verse: Forget not the voice of thine adversaries:

1.verse: We give thanks unto thee, O God;

2.verse: When I shall find the set time, I will judge uprightly.

3.verse: The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved:

4.verse: I said unto the arrogant, Deal not arrogantly;

5.verse: Lift not up your horn on high;

6.verse: For neither from the east, nor from the west,

7.verse: But God is the judge:

8.verse: For in the hand of Jehovah there is a cup, and the wine foameth;

9.verse: But I will declare for ever,

10.verse: All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off;

1.verse: In Judah is God known:

2.verse: In Salem also is his tabernacle,

3.verse: There he brake the arrows of the bow;

4.verse: Glorious art thou and excellent,

5.verse: The stouthearted are made a spoil,

6.verse: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob,

7.verse: Thou, even thou, art to be feared;

8.verse: Thou didst cause sentence to be heard from heaven;

9.verse: When God arose to judgment,

10.verse: Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee:

11.verse: Vow, and pay unto Jehovah your God:

12.verse: He will cut off the spirit of princes:

1.verse: I will cry unto God with my voice,

2.verse: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord:

3.verse: I remember God, and am disquieted:

4.verse: Thou holdest mine eyes watching:

5.verse: I have considered the days of old,

6.verse: I call to remembrance my song in the night:

7.verse: Will the Lord cast off for ever?

8.verse: Is his lovingkindness clean gone for ever?

9.verse: Hath God forgotten to be gracious?

10.verse: And I said, This is my infirmity;

11.verse: I will make mention of the deeds of Jehovah;

12.verse: I will meditate also upon all thy work,

13.verse: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary:

14.verse: Thou art the God that doest wonders:

15.verse: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people,

16.verse: The waters saw thee, O God;

17.verse: The clouds poured out water;

18.verse: The voice of thy thunder was in the whirlwind;

19.verse: Thy way was in the sea,

20.verse: Thou leddest thy people like a flock,

1.verse: Give ear, O my people, to my law:

2.verse: I will open my mouth in a parable;

3.verse: Which we have heard and known,

4.verse: We will not hide them from their children,

5.verse: For he established a testimony in Jacob,

6.verse: That the generation to come might know them , even the children that should be born;

7.verse: That they might set their hope in God,

8.verse: And might not be as their fathers,

9.verse: The children of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows,

10.verse: They kept not the covenant of God,

11.verse: And they forgat his doings,

12.verse: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers,

13.verse: He clave the sea, and caused them to pass through;

14.verse: In the day-time also he led them with a cloud,

15.verse: He clave rocks in the wilderness,

16.verse: He brought streams also out of the rock,

17.verse: Yet went they on still to sin against him,

18.verse: And they tempted God in their heart

19.verse: Yea, they spake against God;

20.verse: Behold, he smote the rock, so that waters gushed out,

21.verse: Therefore Jehovah heard, and was wroth;

22.verse: Because they believed not in God,

23.verse: Yet he commanded the skies above,

24.verse: And he rained down manna upon them to eat,

25.verse: Man did eat the bread of the mighty:

26.verse: He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens;

27.verse: He rained flesh also upon them as the dust,

28.verse: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp,

29.verse: So they did eat, and were well filled;

30.verse: They were not estranged from that which they desired,

31.verse: When the anger of God went up against them,

32.verse: For all this they sinned still,

33.verse: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity,

34.verse: When he slew them, then they inquired after him;

35.verse: And they remembered that God was their rock,

36.verse: But they flattered him with their mouth,

37.verse: For their heart was not right with him,

38.verse: But he, being merciful, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not:

39.verse: And he remembered that they were but flesh,

40.verse: How oft did they rebel against him in the wilderness,

41.verse: And they turned again and tempted God,

43.verse: How he set his signs in Egypt,

44.verse: And turned their rivers into blood,

45.verse: He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them;

46.verse: He gave also their increase unto the caterpillar,

47.verse: He destroyed their vines with hail,

48.verse: He gave over their cattle also to the hail,

49.verse: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger,

50.verse: He made a path for his anger;

51.verse: And smote all the first-born in Egypt,

52.verse: But he led forth his own people like sheep,

53.verse: And he led them safely, so that they feared not;

54.verse: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary,

55.verse: He drove out the nations also before them,

56.verse: Yet they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God,

57.verse: But turned back, and dealt treacherously like their fathers:

58.verse: For they provoked him to anger with their high places,

59.verse: When God heard this , he was wroth,

60.verse: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh,

61.verse: And delivered his strength into captivity,

62.verse: He gave his people over also unto the sword,

64.verse: Their priests fell by the sword;

65.verse: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep,

66.verse: And he smote his adversaries backward:

67.verse: Moreover he refused the tent of Joseph,

68.verse: But chose the tribe of Judah,

69.verse: And he built his sanctuary like the heights,

70.verse: He chose David also his servant,

71.verse: From following the ewes that have their young he brought him,

72.verse: So he was their shepherd according to the integrity of his heart,

1.verse: O God, the nations are come into thine inheritance;

2.verse: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be food unto the birds of the heavens,

3.verse: Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem;

4.verse: We are become a reproach to our neighbors,

5.verse: How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou be angry for ever?

6.verse: Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that know thee not,

7.verse: For they have devoured Jacob,

8.verse: Remember not against us the iniquities of our forefathers:

9.verse: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name;

10.verse: Wherefore should the nations say, Where is their God?

11.verse: Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee:

12.verse: And render unto our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom

13.verse: So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture

1.verse: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel,

2.verse: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up thy might,

3.verse: Turn us again, O God;

4.verse: O Jehovah God of hosts,

5.verse: Thou hast fed them with the bread of tears,

6.verse: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbors;

7.verse: Turn us again, O God of hosts;

8.verse: Thou broughtest a vine out of Egypt:

9.verse: Thou preparedst room before it,

10.verse: The mountains were covered with the shadow of it,

11.verse: It sent out its branches unto the sea,

12.verse: Why hast thou broken down its walls,

13.verse: The boar out of the wood doth ravage it,

14.verse: Turn again, we beseech thee, O God of hosts:

15.verse: And the stock which thy right hand planted,

16.verse: It is burned with fire, it is cut down:

17.verse: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand,

18.verse: So shall we not go back from thee:

19.verse: Turn us again, O Jehovah God of hosts;

1.verse: Sing aloud unto God our strength:

2.verse: Raise a song, and bring hither the timbrel,

3.verse: Blow the trumpet at the new moon,

4.verse: For it is a statute for Israel,

5.verse: He appointed it in Joseph for a testimony,

6.verse: I removed his shoulder from the burden:

7.verse: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee;

8.verse: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee:

9.verse: There shall no strange god be in thee;

10.verse: I am Jehovah thy God,

11.verse: But my people hearkened not to my voice;

12.verse: So I let them go after the stubbornness of their heart,

13.verse: Oh that my people would hearken unto me,

14.verse: I would soon subdue their enemies,

15.verse: The haters of Jehovah should submit themselves unto him:

16.verse: He would feed them also with the finest of the wheat;

1.verse: God standeth in the congregation of God;

2.verse: How long will ye judge unjustly,

3.verse: Judge the poor and fatherless:

4.verse: Rescue the poor and needy:

5.verse: They know not, neither do they understand;

6.verse: I said, Ye are gods,

7.verse: Nevertheless ye shall die like men,

8.verse: Arise, O God, judge the earth;

1.verse: O God, keep not thou silence:

2.verse: For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult;

3.verse: They take crafty counsel against thy people,

4.verse: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation;

5.verse: For they have consulted together with one consent;

6.verse: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites;

7.verse: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek;

8.verse: Assyria also is joined with them;

9.verse: Do thou unto them as unto Midian,

10.verse: Who perished at Endor,

11.verse: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb;

12.verse: Who said, Let us take to ourselves in possession

13.verse: O my God, make them like the whirling dust;

14.verse: As the fire that burneth the forest,

15.verse: So pursue them with thy tempest,

16.verse: Fill their faces with confusion,

17.verse: Let them be put to shame and dismayed for ever;

18.verse: That they may know that thou alone, whose name is Jehovah,

1.verse: How amiable are thy tabernacles,

2.verse: My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of Jehovah;

3.verse: Yea, the sparrow hath found her a house,

4.verse: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house:

5.verse: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee;

6.verse: Passing through the valley of Weeping they make it a place of springs;

7.verse: They go from strength to strength;

8.verse: O Jehovah God of hosts, hear my prayer;

9.verse: Behold, O God our shield,

10.verse: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand.

11.verse: For Jehovah God is a sun and a shield:

12.verse: O Jehovah of hosts,

1.verse: Jehovah, thou hast been favorable unto thy land;

2.verse: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people;

3.verse: Thou hast taken away all thy wrath;

4.verse: Turn us, O God of our salvation,

5.verse: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever?

6.verse: Wilt thou not quicken us again,

7.verse: Show us thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah,

8.verse: I will hear what God Jehovah will speak;

9.verse: Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him,

10.verse: Mercy and truth are met together;

11.verse: Truth springeth out of the earth;

12.verse: Yea, Jehovah will give that which is good;

13.verse: Righteousness shall go before him,

1.verse: Bow down thine ear, O Jehovah, and answer me;

2.verse: Preserve my soul; for I am godly:

3.verse: Be merciful unto me, O Lord;

4.verse: Rejoice the soul of thy servant;

5.verse: For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive,

6.verse: Give ear, O Jehovah, unto my prayer;

7.verse: In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee;

8.verse: There is none like unto thee among the gods, O Lord;

9.verse: All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord;

10.verse: For thou art great, and doest wondrous things:

11.verse: Teach me thy way, O Jehovah; I will walk in thy truth:

12.verse: I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with my whole heart;

13.verse: For great is thy lovingkindness toward me;

14.verse: O God, the proud are risen up against me,

15.verse: But thou, O Lord, art a God merciful and gracious,

16.verse: Oh turn unto me, and have mercy upon me;

17.verse: Show me a token for good,

1.verse: His foundation is in the holy mountains.

2.verse: Jehovah loveth the gates of Zion

3.verse: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah

4.verse: I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon as among them that know me:

5.verse: Yea, of Zion it shall be said, This one and that one was born in her;

6.verse: Jehovah will count, when he writeth up the peoples,

7.verse: They that sing as well as they that dance shall say ,

1.verse: O Jehovah, the God of my salvation,

2.verse: Let my prayer enter into thy presence;

3.verse: For my soul is full of troubles,

4.verse: I am reckoned with them that go down into the pit;

5.verse: Cast off among the dead,

6.verse: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit,

7.verse: Thy wrath lieth hard upon me,

8.verse: Thou hast put mine acquaintance far from me;

9.verse: Mine eye wasteth away by reason of affliction:

10.verse: Wilt thou show wonders to the dead?

11.verse: Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave?

12.verse: Shall thy wonders be known in the dark?

13.verse: But unto thee, O Jehovah, have I cried;

14.verse: Jehovah, why castest thou off my soul?

15.verse: I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up:

16.verse: Thy fierce wrath is gone over me;

17.verse: They came round about me like water all the day long;

18.verse: Lover and friend hast thou put far from me,

1.verse: I will sing of the lovingkindness of Jehovah for ever:

2.verse: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever;

3.verse: I have made a covenant with my chosen,

4.verse: Thy seed will I establish for ever,

5.verse: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O Jehovah;

6.verse: For who in the skies can be compared unto Jehovah?

7.verse: A God very terrible in the council of the holy ones,

8.verse: O Jehovah God of hosts,

9.verse: Thou rulest the pride of the sea:

10.verse: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain;

11.verse: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine:

12.verse: The north and the south, thou hast created them:

13.verse: Thou hast a mighty arm;

14.verse: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of thy throne:

15.verse: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound:

16.verse: In thy name do they rejoice all the day;

17.verse: For thou art the glory of their strength;

18.verse: For our shield belongeth unto Jehovah;

19.verse: Then thou spakest in vision to thy saints,

20.verse: I have found David my servant;

21.verse: With whom my hand shall be established;

22.verse: The enemy shall not exact from him,

23.verse: And I will beat down his adversaries before him,

24.verse: But my faithfulness and my lovingkindness shall be with him;

25.verse: I will set his hand also on the sea,

26.verse: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my Father,

27.verse: I also will make him my first-born,

28.verse: My lovingkindness will I keep for him for evermore;

29.verse: His seed also will I make to endure for ever,

30.verse: If his children forsake my law,

32.verse: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod,

33.verse: But my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him,

34.verse: My covenant will I not break,

35.verse: Once have I sworn by my holiness:

36.verse: His seed shall endure for ever,

37.verse: It shall be established for ever as the moon,

38.verse: But thou hast cast off and rejected,

39.verse: Thou hast abhorred the covenant of thy servant:

40.verse: Thou hast broken down all his hedges;

41.verse: All that pass by the way rob him:

42.verse: Thou hast exalted the right hand of his adversaries;

43.verse: Yea, thou turnest back the edge of his sword,

44.verse: Thou hast made his brightness to cease,

45.verse: The days of his youth hast thou shortened:

46.verse: How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou hide thyself for ever?

47.verse: Oh remember how short my time is:

48.verse: What man is he that shall live and not see death,

49.verse: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses,

50.verse: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants;

51.verse: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O Jehovah,

1.verse: Lord, thou hast been our dwelling-place

2.verse: Before the mountains were brought forth,

3.verse: Thou turnest man to destruction,

4.verse: For a thousand years in thy sight

5.verse: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep:

6.verse: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up;

7.verse: For we are consumed in thine anger,

8.verse: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee,

9.verse: For all our days are passed away in thy wrath:

10.verse: The days of our years are threescore years and ten,

11.verse: Who knoweth the power of thine anger,

12.verse: So teach us to number our days,

13.verse: Return, O Jehovah; how long?

14.verse: Oh satisfy us in the morning with thy lovingkindness,

15.verse: Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us,

16.verse: Let thy work appear unto thy servants,

17.verse: And let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us;

1.verse: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High

2.verse: I will say of Jehovah, He is my refuge and my fortress;

3.verse: For he will deliver thee from the snare of the fowler,

4.verse: He will cover thee with his pinions,

5.verse: Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night,

6.verse: For the pestilence that walketh in darkness,

7.verse: A thousand shall fall at thy side,

8.verse: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold,

9.verse: For thou, O Jehovah, art my refuge!

10.verse: There shall no evil befall thee,

11.verse: For he will give his angels charge over thee,

12.verse: They shall bear thee up in their hands,

13.verse: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder:

14.verse: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him:

15.verse: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him;

16.verse: With long life will I satisfy him,

1.verse: It is a good thing to give thanks unto Jehovah,

2.verse: To show forth thy lovingkindness in the morning,

3.verse: With an instrument of ten strings, and with the psaltery;

4.verse: For thou, Jehovah, hast made me glad through thy work:

5.verse: How great are thy works, O Jehovah!

6.verse: A brutish man knoweth not;

7.verse: When the wicked spring as the grass,

8.verse: But thou, O Jehovah, art on high for evermore.

9.verse: For, lo, thine enemies, O Jehovah,

10.verse: But my horn hast thou exalted like the horn of the wild-ox:

11.verse: Mine eye also hath seen my desire on mine enemies,

12.verse: The righteous shall flourish like the palm-tree:

13.verse: They are planted in the house of Jehovah;

14.verse: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age;

15.verse: To show that Jehovah is upright;

1.verse: Jehovah reigneth; he is clothed with majesty;

2.verse: Thy throne is established of old:

3.verse: The floods have lifted up, O Jehovah,

4.verse: Above the voices of many waters,

5.verse: Thy testimonies are very sure:

1.verse: O Jehovah, thou God to whom vengeance belongeth,

2.verse: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth:

3.verse: Jehovah, how long shall the wicked,

4.verse: They prate, they speak arrogantly:

5.verse: They break in pieces thy people, O Jehovah,

6.verse: They slay the widow and the sojourner,

7.verse: And they say, Jehovah will not see,

8.verse: Consider, ye brutish among the people;

9.verse: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear?

10.verse: He that chastiseth the nations, shall not he correct,
