11.verse: Jehovah knoweth the thoughts of man,

12.verse: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Jehovah,

13.verse: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity,

14.verse: For Jehovah will not cast off his people,

15.verse: For judgment shall return unto righteousness;

16.verse: Who will rise up for me against the evil-doers?

17.verse: Unless Jehovah had been my help,

18.verse: When I said, My foot slippeth;

19.verse: In the multitude of my thoughts within me Thy comforts delight my soul.

20.verse: Shall the throne of wickedness have fellowship with thee,

21.verse: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous,

22.verse: But Jehovah hath been my high tower,

23.verse: And he hath brought upon them their own iniquity,

1.verse: Oh come, let us sing unto Jehovah;

2.verse: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving;

3.verse: For Jehovah is a great God,

4.verse: In his hand are the deep places of the earth;

5.verse: The sea is his, and he made it;

6.verse: Oh come, let us worship and bow down;

7.verse: For he is our God,

8.verse: Harden not your heart, as at Meribah,

9.verse: When your fathers tempted me,

10.verse: Forty years long was I grieved with that generation,

11.verse: Wherefore I sware in my wrath,

1.verse: Oh sing unto Jehovah a new song:

2.verse: Sing unto Jehovah, bless his name;

3.verse: Declare his glory among the nations,

4.verse: For great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised:

5.verse: For all the gods of the peoples are idols;

6.verse: Honor and majesty are before him:

7.verse: Ascribe unto Jehovah, ye kindreds of the peoples,

8.verse: Ascribe unto Jehovah the glory due unto his name:

9.verse: Oh worship Jehovah in holy array:

10.verse: Say among the nations, Jehovah reigneth:

11.verse: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice;

12.verse: Let the field exult, and all that is therein;

13.verse: Before Jehovah; for he cometh,

1.verse: Jehovah reigneth; let the earth rejoice;

2.verse: Clouds and darkness are round about him:

3.verse: A fire goeth before him,

4.verse: His lightnings lightened the world:

5.verse: The mountains melted like wax at the presence of Jehovah,

6.verse: The heavens declare his righteousness,

7.verse: Let all them be put to shame that serve graven images,

8.verse: Zion heard and was glad,

9.verse: For thou, Jehovah, art most high above all the earth:

10.verse: O ye that love Jehovah, hate evil:

11.verse: Light is sown for the righteous,

12.verse: Be glad in Jehovah, ye righteous;

1.verse: Oh sing unto Jehovah a new song;

2.verse: Jehovah hath made known his salvation:

3.verse: He hath remembered his lovingkindness and his faithfulness toward the house of Israel:

4.verse: Make a joyful noise unto Jehovah, all the earth:

5.verse: Sing praises unto Jehovah with the harp;

6.verse: With trumpets and sound of cornet

7.verse: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;

8.verse: Let the floods clap their hands;

9.verse: Before Jehovah; for he cometh to judge the earth:

1.verse: Jehovah reigneth; let the peoples tremble:

2.verse: Jehovah is great in Zion;

3.verse: Let them praise thy great and terrible name:

4.verse: The king’s strength also loveth justice;

5.verse: Exalt ye Jehovah our God,

6.verse: Moses and Aaron among his priests,

7.verse: He spake unto them in the pillar of cloud:

8.verse: Thou answeredst them, O Jehovah our God:

9.verse: Exalt ye Jehovah our God,

1.verse: Make a joyful noise unto Jehovah, all ye lands.

2.verse: Serve Jehovah with gladness:

3.verse: Know ye that Jehovah, he is God:

4.verse: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving,

5.verse: For Jehovah is good; his lovingkindness endureth for ever,

1.verse: I will sing of lovingkindness and justice:

2.verse: I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way:

3.verse: I will set no base thing before mine eyes:

4.verse: A perverse heart shall depart from me:

5.verse: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbor, him will I destroy:

6.verse: Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me:

7.verse: He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house:

8.verse: Morning by morning will I destroy all the wicked of the land;

1.verse: Hear my prayer, O Jehovah,

2.verse: Hide not thy face from me in the day of my distress:

3.verse: For my days consume away like smoke,

4.verse: My heart is smitten like grass, and withered;

5.verse: By reason of the voice of my groaning

6.verse: I am like a pelican of the wilderness;

7.verse: I watch, and am become like a sparrow

8.verse: Mine enemies reproach me all the day;

9.verse: For I have eaten ashes like bread,

10.verse: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath:

11.verse: My days are like a shadow that declineth;

12.verse: But thou, O Jehovah, wilt abide for ever;

13.verse: Thou wilt arise, and have mercy upon Zion;

14.verse: For thy servants take pleasure in her stones,

15.verse: So the nations shall fear the name of Jehovah,

16.verse: For Jehovah hath built up Zion;

17.verse: He hath regarded the prayer of the destitute,

18.verse: This shall be written for the generation to come;

19.verse: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary;

20.verse: To hear the sighing of the prisoner;

21.verse: That men may declare the name of Jehovah in Zion,

22.verse: When the peoples are gathered together,

23.verse: He weakened my strength in the way;

24.verse: I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days:

25.verse: Of old didst thou lay the foundation of the earth;

26.verse: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure;

28.verse: The children of thy servants shall continue,

1.verse: Bless Jehovah, O my soul;

2.verse: Bless Jehovah, O my soul,

3.verse: Who forgiveth all thine iniquities;

4.verse: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction;

5.verse: Who satisfieth thy desire with good things,

6.verse: Jehovah executeth righteous acts,

7.verse: He made known his ways unto Moses,

8.verse: Jehovah is merciful and gracious,

9.verse: He will not always chide;

10.verse: He hath not dealt with us after our sins,

11.verse: For as the heavens are high above the earth,

12.verse: As far as the east is from the west,

13.verse: Like as a father pitieth his children,

14.verse: For he knoweth our frame;

15.verse: As for man, his days are as grass;

16.verse: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone;

17.verse: But the lovingkindness of Jehovah is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him,

18.verse: To such as keep his covenant,

19.verse: Jehovah hath established his throne in the heavens;

20.verse: Bless Jehovah, ye his angels,

21.verse: Bless Jehovah, all ye his hosts,

22.verse: Bless Jehovah, all ye his works,

1.verse: Bless Jehovah, O my soul.

2.verse: Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment;

3.verse: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters;

4.verse: Who maketh winds his messengers;

5.verse: Who laid the foundations of the earth,

6.verse: Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a vesture;

7.verse: At thy rebuke they fled;

8.verse: (The mountains rose, the valleys sank down)

9.verse: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over;

10.verse: He sendeth forth springs into the valleys;

11.verse: They give drink to every beast of the field;

12.verse: By them the birds of the heavens have their habitation;

13.verse: He watereth the mountains from his chambers:

14.verse: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle,

15.verse: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man,

16.verse: The trees of Jehovah are filled with moisture ,

17.verse: Where the birds make their nests:

18.verse: The high mountains are for the wild goats;

19.verse: He appointed the moon for seasons:

20.verse: Thou makest darkness, and it is night,

21.verse: The young lions roar after their prey,

22.verse: The sun ariseth, they get them away,

23.verse: Man goeth forth unto his work

24.verse: O Jehovah, how manifold are thy works!

25.verse: Yonder is the sea, great and wide,

28.verse: Thou givest unto them, they gather;

29.verse: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled;

30.verse: Thou sendest forth thy Spirit, they are created;

31.verse: Let the glory of Jehovah endure for ever;

32.verse: Who looketh on the earth, and it trembleth;

33.verse: I will sing unto Jehovah as long as I live:

34.verse: Let my meditation be sweet unto him:

35.verse: Let sinners be consumed out of the earth.

1.verse: Oh give thanks unto Jehovah, call upon his name;

2.verse: Sing unto him, sing praises unto him;

3.verse: Glory ye in his holy name:

4.verse: Seek ye Jehovah and his strength;

5.verse: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done,

6.verse: O ye seed of Abraham his servant,

7.verse: He is Jehovah our God:

8.verse: He hath remembered his covenant for ever,

9.verse: The covenant which he made with Abraham,

10.verse: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a statute,

11.verse: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan,

12.verse: When they were but a few men in number,

13.verse: And they went about from nation to nation,

14.verse: He suffered no man to do them wrong;

15.verse: Saying , Touch not mine anointed ones,

16.verse: And he called for a famine upon the land;

17.verse: He sent a man before them;

18.verse: His feet they hurt with fetters:

19.verse: Until the time that his word came to pass,

20.verse: The king sent and loosed him;

21.verse: He made him lord of his house,

22.verse: To bind his princes at his pleasure,

23.verse: Israel also came into Egypt;

24.verse: And he increased his people greatly,

25.verse: He turned their heart to hate his people,

27.verse: They set among them his signs,

28.verse: He sent darkness, and made it dark;

29.verse: He turned their waters into blood,

31.verse: He spake, and there came swarms of flies,

32.verse: He gave them hail for rain,

33.verse: He smote their vines also and their fig-trees,

34.verse: He spake, and the locust came,

35.verse: And did eat up every herb in their land,

36.verse: He smote also all the first-born in their land,

37.verse: And he brought them forth with silver and gold;

38.verse: Egypt was glad when they departed;

39.verse: He spread a cloud for a covering,

40.verse: They asked, and he brought quails,

41.verse: He opened the rock, and waters gushed out;

42.verse: For he remembered his holy word,

43.verse: And he brought forth his people with joy,

44.verse: And he gave them the lands of the nations;

45.verse: That they might keep his statutes,

1.verse: Praise ye Jehovah.

2.verse: Who can utter the mighty acts of Jehovah,

3.verse: Blessed are they that keep justice,

4.verse: Remember me, O Jehovah, with the favor that thou bearest unto thy people;

5.verse: That I may see the prosperity of thy chosen,

6.verse: We have sinned with our fathers,

7.verse: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt;

8.verse: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake,

9.verse: He rebuked the Red Sea also, and it was dried up:

10.verse: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them,

11.verse: And the waters covered their adversaries;

12.verse: Then believed they his words;

13.verse: They soon forgat his works;

14.verse: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness,

15.verse: And he gave them their request,

16.verse: They envied Moses also in the camp,

17.verse: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,

18.verse: And a fire was kindled in their company;

19.verse: They made a calf in Horeb,

20.verse: Thus they changed their glory

21.verse: They forgat God their Saviour,

22.verse: Wondrous works in the land of Ham,

23.verse: Therefore he said that he would destroy them,

24.verse: Yea, they despised the pleasant land,

27.verse: And that he would overthrow their seed among the nations,

28.verse: They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor,

29.verse: Thus they provoked him to anger with their doings;

30.verse: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment;

31.verse: And that was reckoned unto him for righteousness,

32.verse: They angered him also at the waters of Meribah,

33.verse: Because they were rebellious against his spirit,

34.verse: They did not destroy the peoples,

35.verse: But mingled themselves with the nations,

37.verse: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto demons,

39.verse: Thus were they defiled with their works,

40.verse: Therefore was the wrath of Jehovah kindled against his people,

41.verse: And he gave them into the hand of the nations;

43.verse: Many times did he deliver them;

45.verse: And he remembered for them his covenant,

46.verse: He made them also to be pitied

47.verse: Save us, O Jehovah our God,

48.verse: Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel,

1.verse: Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good;

2.verse: Let the redeemed of Jehovah say so ,

3.verse: And gathered out of the lands,

4.verse: They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way;

5.verse: Hungry and thirsty,

6.verse: Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble,

7.verse: He led them also by a straight way,

8.verse: Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,

9.verse: For he satisfieth the longing soul,

10.verse: Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death,

11.verse: Because they rebelled against the words of God,

12.verse: Therefore he brought down their heart with labor;

13.verse: Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble,

14.verse: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death,

15.verse: Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,

16.verse: For he hath broken the gates of brass,

17.verse: Fools because of their transgression,

18.verse: Their soul abhorreth all manner of food;

19.verse: Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble,

20.verse: He sendeth his word, and healeth them,

21.verse: Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,

22.verse: And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving,

23.verse: They that go down to the sea in ships,

24.verse: These see the works of Jehovah,

25.verse: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind,

26.verse: They mount up to the heavens, they go down again to the depths:

27.verse: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man,

28.verse: Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble,

29.verse: He maketh the storm a calm,

30.verse: Then are they glad because they are quiet;

31.verse: Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,

32.verse: Let them exalt him also in the assembly of the people,

33.verse: He turneth rivers into a wilderness,

34.verse: A fruitful land into a salt desert,

35.verse: He turneth a wilderness into a pool of water,

36.verse: And there he maketh the hungry to dwell,

37.verse: And sow fields, and plant vineyards,

38.verse: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly;

39.verse: Again, they are diminished and bowed down

41.verse: Yet setteth he the needy on high from affliction,

42.verse: The upright shall see it, and be glad;

43.verse: Whoso is wise will give heed to these things;

1.verse: My heart is fixed, O God;

2.verse: Awake, psaltery and harp:

3.verse: I will give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah, among the peoples;

4.verse: For thy lovingkindness is great above the heavens;

5.verse: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens,

6.verse: That thy beloved may be delivered,

7.verse: God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult;

8.verse: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine;

9.verse: Moab is my washpot;

10.verse: Who will bring me into the fortified city?

11.verse: Hast not thou cast us off, O God?

12.verse: Give us help against the adversary;

13.verse: Through God we shall do valiantly:

1.verse: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

2.verse: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit have they opened against me:

3.verse: They have compassed me about also with words of hatred,

4.verse: For my love they are my adversaries:

5.verse: And they have rewarded me evil for good,

6.verse: Set thou a wicked man over him;

7.verse: When he is judged, let him come forth guilty;

8.verse: Let his days be few;

9.verse: Let his children be fatherless,

10.verse: Let his children be vagabonds, and beg;

11.verse: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath;

12.verse: Let there be none to extend kindness unto him;

13.verse: Let his posterity be cut off;

14.verse: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with Jehovah;

15.verse: Let them be before Jehovah continually,

16.verse: Because he remembered not to show kindness,

17.verse: Yea, he loved cursing, and it came unto him;

18.verse: He clothed himself also with cursing as with his garment,

19.verse: Let it be unto him as the raiment wherewith he covereth himself,

20.verse: This is the reward of mine adversaries from Jehovah,

21.verse: But deal thou with me, O Jehovah the Lord, for thy name’s sake:

22.verse: For I am poor and needy,

23.verse: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth:

24.verse: My knees are weak through fasting;

25.verse: I am become also a reproach unto them:

26.verse: Help me, O Jehovah my God;

27.verse: That they may know that this is thy hand;

28.verse: Let them curse, but bless thou:

29.verse: Let mine adversaries be clothed with dishonor,

30.verse: I will give great thanks unto Jehovah with my mouth;

31.verse: For he will stand at the right hand of the needy,

1.verse: Jehovah saith unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand,

2.verse: Jehovah will send forth the rod of thy strength out of Zion:

3.verse: Thy people offer themselves willingly

4.verse: Jehovah hath sworn, and will not repent:

5.verse: The Lord at thy right hand

6.verse: He will judge among the nations,

7.verse: He will drink of the brook in the way:

1.verse: Praise ye Jehovah.

2.verse: The works of Jehovah are great,

3.verse: His work is honor and majesty;

4.verse: He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered:

5.verse: He hath given food unto them that fear him:

6.verse: He hath showed his people the power of his works,

7.verse: The works of his hands are truth and justice;

8.verse: They are established for ever and ever;

9.verse: He hath sent redemption unto his people;

10.verse: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom;

1.verse: Praise ye Jehovah.

2.verse: His seed shall be mighty upon earth:

3.verse: Wealth and riches are in his house;

4.verse: Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness:

5.verse: Well is it with the man that dealeth graciously and lendeth;

6.verse: For he shall never be moved;

7.verse: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings:

8.verse: His heart is established, he shall not be afraid,

9.verse: He hath dispersed, he hath given to the needy;

10.verse: The wicked shall see it, and be grieved;

1.verse: Praise ye Jehovah.

2.verse: Blessed be the name of Jehovah

3.verse: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same

4.verse: Jehovah is high above all nations,

5.verse: Who is like unto Jehovah our God,

6.verse: That humbleth himself to behold

7.verse: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust,

8.verse: That he may set him with princes,

9.verse: He maketh the barren woman to keep house,

1.verse: When Israel went forth out of Egypt,

2.verse: Judah became his sanctuary,

3.verse: The sea saw it, and fled;

4.verse: The mountains skipped like rams,

5.verse: What aileth thee, O thou sea, that thou fleest?

6.verse: Ye mountains, that ye skip like rams;

7.verse: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord,

8.verse: Who turned the rock into a pool of water,

1.verse: Not unto us, O Jehovah, not unto us,

2.verse: Wherefore should the nations say,

3.verse: But our God is in the heavens:

4.verse: Their idols are silver and gold,

5.verse: They have mouths, but they speak not;

6.verse: They have ears, but they hear not;

7.verse: They have hands, but they handle not;

8.verse: They that make them shall be like unto them;

9.verse: O Israel, trust thou in Jehovah:

10.verse: O house of Aaron, trust ye in Jehovah:

11.verse: Ye that fear Jehovah, trust in Jehovah:

12.verse: Jehovah hath been mindful of us; he will bless us :

13.verse: He will bless them that fear Jehovah,

14.verse: Jehovah increase you more and more,

15.verse: Blessed are ye of Jehovah,

16.verse: The heavens are the heavens of Jehovah;

17.verse: The dead praise not Jehovah,

18.verse: But we will bless Jehovah

1.verse: I love Jehovah, because he heareth

2.verse: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me,

3.verse: The cords of death compassed me,

4.verse: Then called I upon the name of Jehovah:

5.verse: Gracious is Jehovah, and righteous;

6.verse: Jehovah preserveth the simple:

7.verse: Return unto thy rest, O my soul;

8.verse: For thou hast delivered my soul from death,

9.verse: I will walk before Jehovah

10.verse: I believe, for I will speak:

11.verse: I said in my haste,

12.verse: What shall I render unto Jehovah

13.verse: I will take the cup of salvation,

14.verse: I will pay my vows unto Jehovah,

15.verse: Precious in the sight of Jehovah

16.verse: O Jehovah, truly I am thy servant:

17.verse: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving,

18.verse: I will pay my vows unto Jehovah,

19.verse: In the courts of Jehovah’s house,

1.verse: Oh praise Jehovah, all ye nations;

2.verse: For his lovingkindness is great toward us;

1.verse: Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good;

2.verse: Let Israel now say,

3.verse: Let the house of Aaron now say,

4.verse: Let them now that fear Jehovah say,

5.verse: Out of my distress I called upon Jehovah:

6.verse: Jehovah is on my side; I will not fear:

7.verse: Jehovah is on my side among them that help me:

8.verse: It is better to take refuge in Jehovah

9.verse: It is better to take refuge in Jehovah

10.verse: All nations compassed me about:

11.verse: They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about:

12.verse: They compassed me about like bees;

13.verse: Thou didst thrust sore at me that I might fall;

14.verse: Jehovah is my strength and song;

15.verse: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents of the righteous:

16.verse: The right hand of Jehovah is exalted:

17.verse: I shall not die, but live,

18.verse: Jehovah hath chastened me sore;

19.verse: Open to me the gates of righteousness:

20.verse: This is the gate of Jehovah;

21.verse: I will give thanks unto thee; for thou hast answered me,

22.verse: The stone which the builders rejected

23.verse: This is Jehovah’s doing;

24.verse: This is the day which Jehovah hath made;

25.verse: Save now, we beseech thee, O Jehovah:

26.verse: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of Jehovah:

27.verse: Jehovah is God, and he hath given us light:

28.verse: Thou art my God, and I will give thanks unto thee:

29.verse: Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good;

1.verse: Blessed are they that are perfect in the way,

2.verse: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies,

3.verse: Yea, they do no unrighteousness;

4.verse: Thou hast commanded us thy precepts,

5.verse: Oh that my ways were established

6.verse: Then shall I not be put to shame,

7.verse: I will give thanks unto thee with uprightness of heart,

8.verse: I will observe thy statutes:

9.verse: Wherewith shall a young man cleanse his way?

10.verse: With my whole heart have I sought thee:

11.verse: Thy word have I laid up in my heart,

12.verse: Blessed art thou, O Jehovah:

13.verse: With my lips have I declared

14.verse: I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies,

15.verse: I will meditate on thy precepts,

16.verse: I will delight myself in thy statutes:

17.verse: Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live;

18.verse: Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold

19.verse: I am a sojourner in the earth:

20.verse: My soul breaketh for the longing

21.verse: Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed,

22.verse: Take away from me reproach and contempt;

23.verse: Princes also sat and talked against me;

24.verse: Thy testimonies also are my delight

25.verse: My soul cleaveth unto the dust:

26.verse: I declared my ways, and thou answeredst me:

27.verse: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts:

29.verse: Remove from me the way of falsehood;

30.verse: I have chosen the way of faithfulness:

32.verse: I will run the way of thy commandments,

33.verse: Teach me, O Jehovah, the way of thy statutes;

34.verse: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law;

35.verse: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments;

36.verse: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies,

37.verse: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity,

38.verse: Confirm unto thy servant thy word,

39.verse: Turn away my reproach whereof I am afraid;

40.verse: Behold, I have longed after thy precepts:

41.verse: Let thy lovingkindnesses also come unto me, O Jehovah,

42.verse: So shall I have an answer for him that reproacheth me;

43.verse: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth;

44.verse: So shall I observe thy law continually

45.verse: And I shall walk at liberty;

46.verse: I will also speak of thy testimonies before kings,

47.verse: And I will delight myself in thy commandments,

48.verse: I will lift up my hands also unto thy commandments, which I have loved;

49.verse: Remember the word unto thy servant,

50.verse: This is my comfort in my affliction;

51.verse: The proud have had me greatly in derision:

52.verse: I have remembered thine ordinances of old, O Jehovah,

53.verse: Hot indignation hath taken hold upon me,

54.verse: Thy statutes have been my songs

55.verse: I have remembered thy name, O Jehovah, in the night,

58.verse: I entreated thy favor with my whole heart:

60.verse: I made haste, and delayed not,

61.verse: The cords of the wicked have wrapped me round;

62.verse: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee

63.verse: I am a companion of all them that fear thee,

64.verse: The earth, O Jehovah, is full of thy lovingkindness:

65.verse: Thou hast dealt well with thy servant,

66.verse: Teach me good judgment and knowledge;

67.verse: Before I was afflicted I went astray;

68.verse: Thou art good, and doest good;

69.verse: The proud have forged a lie against me:

70.verse: Their heart is as fat as grease;

71.verse: It is good for me that I have been afflicted;

72.verse: The law of thy mouth is better unto me

73.verse: Thy hands have made me and fashioned me:

74.verse: They that fear thee shall see me and be glad,

75.verse: I know, O Jehovah, that thy judgments are righteous,

76.verse: Let, I pray thee, thy lovingkindness be for my comfort,

77.verse: Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live;

78.verse: Let the proud be put to shame;

79.verse: Let those that fear thee turn unto me;

80.verse: Let my heart be perfect in thy statutes,

81.verse: My soul fainteth for thy salvation;

82.verse: Mine eyes fail for thy word,

83.verse: For I am become like a wine-skin in the smoke;

84.verse: How many are the days of thy servant?

85.verse: The proud have digged pits for me,

87.verse: They had almost consumed me upon earth;

90.verse: Thy faithfulness is unto all generations:

91.verse: They abide this day according to thine ordinances;

92.verse: Unless thy law had been my delight,

93.verse: I will never forget thy precepts;

95.verse: The wicked have waited for me, to destroy me;

96.verse: I have seen an end of all perfection;

97.verse: Oh how love I thy law!

98.verse: Thy commandments make me wiser than mine enemies;

99.verse: I have more understanding than all my teachers;

100.verse: I understand more than the aged,

101.verse: I have refrained my feet from every evil way,

102.verse: I have not turned aside from thine ordinances;

103.verse: How sweet are thy words unto my taste!

104.verse: Through thy precepts I get understanding:

105.verse: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet,

106.verse: I have sworn, and have confirmed it,

108.verse: Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill-offerings of my mouth, O Jehovah,

109.verse: My soul is continually in my hand;

110.verse: The wicked have laid a snare for me;

111.verse: Thy testimonies have I taken as a heritage for ever;

112.verse: I have inclined my heart to perform thy statutes

113.verse: I hate them that are of a double mind;

114.verse: Thou art my hiding-place and my shield:

116.verse: Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live;

117.verse: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe,

118.verse: Thou hast set at nought all them that err from thy statutes;

119.verse: Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross:

120.verse: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee;

121.verse: I have done justice and righteousness:

122.verse: Be surety for thy servant for good:

123.verse: Mine eyes fail for thy salvation,

124.verse: Deal with thy servant according unto thy lovingkindness,

125.verse: I am thy servant; give me understanding,

126.verse: It is time for Jehovah to work;

128.verse: Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right;

130.verse: The opening of thy words giveth light;

131.verse: I opened wide my mouth, and panted;

132.verse: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me,

133.verse: Establish my footsteps in thy word;

134.verse: Redeem me from the oppression of man:

135.verse: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant;

136.verse: Streams of water run down mine eyes,

138.verse: Thou hast commanded thy testimonies in righteousness

142.verse: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,

143.verse: Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me;

144.verse: Thy testimonies are righteous for ever:

145.verse: I have called with my whole heart; answer me, O Jehovah:

146.verse: I have called unto thee; save me,

147.verse: I anticipated the dawning of the morning, and cried:

149.verse: Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness:

150.verse: They draw nigh that follow after wickedness;

152.verse: Of old have I known from thy testimonies,

153.verse: Consider mine affliction, and deliver me;

154.verse: Plead thou my cause, and redeem me:

155.verse: Salvation is far from the wicked;

156.verse: Great are thy tender mercies, O Jehovah:

157.verse: Many are my persecutors and mine adversaries;

158.verse: I beheld the treacherous, and was grieved,

159.verse: Consider how I love thy precepts:

160.verse: The sum of thy word is truth;

161.verse: Princes have persecuted me without a cause;

164.verse: Seven times a day do I praise thee,

165.verse: Great peace have they that love thy law;

166.verse: I have hoped for thy salvation, O Jehovah,

167.verse: My soul hath observed thy testimonies;

168.verse: I have observed thy precepts and thy testimonies;

169.verse: Let my cry come near before thee, O Jehovah:

170.verse: Let my supplication come before thee:

172.verse: Let my tongue sing of thy word;

173.verse: Let thy hand be ready to help me;

174.verse: I have longed for thy salvation, O Jehovah;

175.verse: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee;

176.verse: I have gone astray like a lost sheep;

1.verse: In my distress I cried unto Jehovah,

2.verse: Deliver my soul, O Jehovah, from lying lips,

3.verse: What shall be given unto thee, and what shall be done more unto thee,

4.verse: Sharp arrows of the mighty,

5.verse: Woe is me, that I sojourn in Meshech,

6.verse: My soul hath long had her dwelling

7.verse: I am for peace:

1.verse: I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains:

2.verse: My help cometh from Jehovah,

3.verse: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved:

4.verse: Behold, he that keepeth Israel

5.verse: Jehovah is thy keeper:

6.verse: The sun shall not smite thee by day,

7.verse: Jehovah will keep thee from all evil;

8.verse: Jehovah will keep thy going out and thy coming in

1.verse: I was glad when they said unto me,

2.verse: Our feet are standing

3.verse: Jerusalem, that art builded

4.verse: Whither the tribes go up, even the tribes of Jehovah,

5.verse: For there are set thrones for judgment,

6.verse: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:

7.verse: Peace be within thy walls,

8.verse: For my brethren and companions’ sakes,

9.verse: For the sake of the house of Jehovah our God

1.verse: Unto thee do I lift up mine eyes,

2.verse: Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their master,

3.verse: Have mercy upon us, O Jehovah, have mercy upon us;

4.verse: Our soul is exceedingly filled

1.verse: If it had not been Jehovah who was on our side,

2.verse: If it had not been Jehovah who was on our side,

3.verse: Then they had swallowed us up alive,

4.verse: Then the waters had overwhelmed us,

5.verse: Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.

6.verse: Blessed be Jehovah,

7.verse: Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers:

8.verse: Our help is in the name of Jehovah,

1.verse: They that trust in Jehovah

2.verse: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem,

3.verse: For the sceptre of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous;

4.verse: Do good, O Jehovah, unto those that are good,

5.verse: But as for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways,

1.verse: When Jehovah brought back those that returned to Zion,

2.verse: Then was our mouth filled with laughter,

3.verse: Jehovah hath done great things for us,

4.verse: Turn again our captivity, O Jehovah,

5.verse: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.

6.verse: He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing seed for sowing,

1.verse: Except Jehovah build the house,

2.verse: It is vain for you to rise up early,

3.verse: Lo, children are a heritage of Jehovah;

4.verse: As arrows in the hand of a mighty man,

5.verse: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them:

1.verse: Blessed is every one that feareth Jehovah,

2.verse: For thou shalt eat the labor of thy hands:

3.verse: Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine,

4.verse: Behold, thus shall the man be blessed

5.verse: Jehovah bless thee out of Zion:

6.verse: Yea, see thou thy children’s children.

1.verse: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth up,

2.verse: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth up:

3.verse: The plowers plowed upon my back;

4.verse: Jehovah is righteous:

5.verse: Let them be put to shame and turned backward,

6.verse: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops,

7.verse: Wherewith the reaper filleth not his hand,

8.verse: Neither do they that go by say,

1.verse: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Jehovah.

2.verse: Lord, hear my voice:

3.verse: If thou, Jehovah, shouldest mark iniquities,

4.verse: But there is forgiveness with thee,

5.verse: I wait for Jehovah, my soul doth wait,

6.verse: My soul waiteth for the Lord

7.verse: O Israel, hope in Jehovah;

8.verse: And he will redeem Israel

1.verse: Jehovah, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty;

2.verse: Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul;

3.verse: O Israel, hope in Jehovah

1.verse: Jehovah, remember for David

2.verse: How he sware unto Jehovah,

3.verse: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house,

4.verse: I will not give sleep to mine eyes,

5.verse: Until I find out a place for Jehovah,

6.verse: Lo, we heard of it in Ephrathah:

7.verse: We will go into his tabernacles;

8.verse: Arise, O Jehovah, into thy resting-place;

9.verse: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness;

10.verse: For thy servant David’s sake

11.verse: Jehovah hath sworn unto David in truth;

12.verse: If thy children will keep my covenant

13.verse: For Jehovah hath chosen Zion;

14.verse: This is my resting-place for ever:

15.verse: I will abundantly bless her provision:

16.verse: Her priests also will I clothe with salvation;

17.verse: There will I make the horn of David to bud:

18.verse: His enemies will I clothe with shame;

1.verse: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is

2.verse: It is like the precious oil upon the head,

3.verse: Like the dew of Hermon,

1.verse: Behold, bless ye Jehovah, all ye servants of Jehovah,

2.verse: Lift up your hands to the sanctuary,

3.verse: Jehovah bless thee out of Zion;

1.verse: Praise ye Jehovah.

2.verse: Ye that stand in the house of Jehovah,

3.verse: Praise ye Jehovah; for Jehovah is good:

4.verse: For Jehovah hath chosen Jacob unto himself,

5.verse: For I know that Jehovah is great,

6.verse: Whatsoever Jehovah pleased, that hath he done,

7.verse: Who causeth the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth;

8.verse: Who smote the first-born of Egypt,

9.verse: Who sent signs and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt,

10.verse: Who smote many nations,

11.verse: Sihon king of the Amorites,

12.verse: And gave their land for a heritage,

13.verse: Thy name, O Jehovah, endureth for ever;

14.verse: For Jehovah will judge his people,

15.verse: The idols of the nations are silver and gold,

16.verse: They have mouths, but they speak not;

17.verse: They have ears, but they hear not;

18.verse: They that make them shall be like unto them;

19.verse: O house of Israel, bless ye Jehovah:

20.verse: O house of Levi, bless ye Jehovah:

21.verse: Blessed be Jehovah out of Zion,

1.verse: Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good;

2.verse: Oh give thanks unto the God of gods;

3.verse: Oh give thanks unto the Lord of lords;

4.verse: To him who alone doeth great wonders;

5.verse: To him that by understanding made the heavens;

6.verse: To him that spread forth the earth above the waters;

7.verse: To him that made great lights;

8.verse: The sun to rule by day;

9.verse: The moon and stars to rule by night;

10.verse: To him that smote Egypt in their first-born;

11.verse: And brought out Israel from among them;

12.verse: With a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm;

13.verse: To him that divided the Red Sea in sunder;

14.verse: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it;

15.verse: But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea;

16.verse: To him that led his people through the wilderness;

17.verse: To him that smote great kings;

18.verse: And slew famous kings;

19.verse: Sihon king of the Amorites;

20.verse: And Og king of Bashan;

21.verse: And gave their land for a heritage;

22.verse: Even a heritage unto Israel his servant;

23.verse: Who remembered us in our low estate;

24.verse: And hath delivered us from our adversaries;

25.verse: Who giveth food to all flesh;

26.verse: Oh give thanks unto the God of heaven;

1.verse: By the rivers of Babylon,

2.verse: Upon the willows in the midst thereof

3.verse: For there they that led us captive required of us songs,

4.verse: How shall we sing Jehovah’s song

5.verse: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem,

6.verse: Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth,

7.verse: Remember, O Jehovah, against the children of Edom

8.verse: O daughter of Babylon, that art to be destroyed,

9.verse: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones

1.verse: I will give thee thanks with my whole heart:

2.verse: I will worship toward thy holy temple,

3.verse: In the day that I called thou answeredst me,

4.verse: All the kings of the earth shall give thee thanks, O Jehovah,

5.verse: Yea, they shall sing of the ways of Jehovah;

6.verse: For though Jehovah is high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly;

7.verse: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me;

8.verse: Jehovah will perfect that which concerneth me:

1.verse: O Jehovah, thou hast searched me, and known me .

2.verse: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising;

3.verse: Thou searchest out my path and my lying down,

4.verse: For there is not a word in my tongue,

5.verse: Thou hast beset me behind and before,

6.verse: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me;

7.verse: Whither shall I go from thy Spirit?

8.verse: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there:

9.verse: If I take the wings of the morning,

10.verse: Even there shall thy hand lead me,

11.verse: If I say, Surely the darkness shall overwhelm me,

12.verse: Even the darkness hideth not from thee,

13.verse: For thou didst form my inward parts:

14.verse: I will give thanks unto thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made:

15.verse: My frame was not hidden from thee,

16.verse: Thine eyes did see mine unformed substance;

17.verse: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God!

18.verse: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand:

19.verse: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God:

20.verse: For they speak against thee wickedly,

21.verse: Do not I hate them, O Jehovah, that hate thee?

22.verse: I hate them with perfect hatred:

23.verse: Search me, O God, and know my heart:

24.verse: And see if there be any wicked way in me,

1.verse: Deliver me, O Jehovah, from the evil man;

2.verse: Who devise mischiefs in their heart;

3.verse: They have sharpened their tongue like a serpent;

4.verse: Keep me, O Jehovah, from the hands of the wicked;

5.verse: The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords;

6.verse: I said unto Jehovah, Thou art my God:

7.verse: O Jehovah the Lord, the strength of my salvation,

8.verse: Grant not, O Jehovah, the desires of the wicked;

9.verse: As for the head of those that compass me about,

10.verse: Let burning coals fall upon them:

11.verse: An evil speaker shall not be established in the earth:

12.verse: I know that Jehovah will maintain the cause of the afflicted,

13.verse: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name:

1.verse: Jehovah, I have called upon thee; make haste unto me:

2.verse: Let my prayer be set forth as incense before thee;

3.verse: Set a watch, O Jehovah, before my mouth;

4.verse: Incline not my heart to any evil thing,

5.verse: Let the righteous smite me, it shall be a kindness;

6.verse: Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock;

7.verse: As when one ploweth and cleaveth the earth,

8.verse: For mine eyes are unto thee, O Jehovah the Lord:

9.verse: Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me,

10.verse: Let the wicked fall into their own nets,

1.verse: I cry with my voice unto Jehovah;

2.verse: I pour out my complaint before him;

3.verse: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me,

4.verse: Look on my right hand, and see;

5.verse: I cried unto thee, O Jehovah;

6.verse: Attend unto my cry;

7.verse: Bring my soul out of prison,

1.verse: Hear my prayer, O Jehovah; give ear to my supplications:

2.verse: And enter not into judgment with thy servant;

3.verse: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul;

4.verse: Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me;

5.verse: I remember the days of old;

6.verse: I spread forth my hands unto thee:

7.verse: Make haste to answer me, O Jehovah; my spirit faileth:

8.verse: Cause me to hear thy lovingkindness in the morning;

9.verse: Deliver me, O Jehovah, from mine enemies:

10.verse: Teach me to do thy will;

11.verse: Quicken me, O Jehovah, for thy name’s sake:

12.verse: And in thy lovingkindness cut off mine enemies,

1.verse: Blessed be Jehovah my rock,

2.verse: My lovingkindness, and my fortress,

3.verse: Jehovah, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him?

4.verse: Man is like to vanity:

5.verse: Bow thy heavens, O Jehovah, and come down:

6.verse: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them;

7.verse: Stretch forth thy hand from above;

8.verse: Whose mouth speaketh deceit,

9.verse: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God:

10.verse: Thou art he that giveth salvation unto kings;

11.verse: Rescue me, and deliver me out of the hand of aliens,

12.verse: When our sons shall be as plants grown up in their youth,

13.verse: When our garners are full, affording all manner of store,

14.verse: When our oxen are well laden;

15.verse: Happy is the people that is in such a case;

1.verse: I will extol thee, my God, O King;

2.verse: Every day will I bless thee;

3.verse: Great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised;

4.verse: One generation shall laud thy works to another,

5.verse: Of the glorious majesty of thine honor,

6.verse: And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts;

7.verse: They shall utter the memory of thy great goodness,

8.verse: Jehovah is gracious, and merciful;

9.verse: Jehovah is good to all;

10.verse: All thy works shall give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah;

11.verse: They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom,

12.verse: To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts,

13.verse: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,

14.verse: Jehovah upholdeth all that fall,

15.verse: The eyes of all wait for thee;

16.verse: Thou openest thy hand,

17.verse: Jehovah is righteous in all his ways,

18.verse: Jehovah is nigh unto all them that call upon him,

19.verse: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him;

20.verse: Jehovah preserveth all them that love him;

21.verse: My mouth shall speak the praise of Jehovah;

1.verse: Praise ye Jehovah.

2.verse: While I live will I praise Jehovah:

3.verse: Put not your trust in princes,

4.verse: His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth;

5.verse: Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help,

6.verse: Who made heaven and earth,

7.verse: Who executeth justice for the oppressed;

8.verse: Jehovah openeth the eyes of the blind;

9.verse: Jehovah preserveth the sojourners;

10.verse: Jehovah will reign for ever,

1.verse: Praise ye Jehovah;

2.verse: Jehovah doth build up Jerusalem;

3.verse: He healeth the broken in heart,

4.verse: He counteth the number of the stars;

5.verse: Great is our Lord, and mighty in power;

6.verse: Jehovah upholdeth the meek:

7.verse: Sing unto Jehovah with thanksgiving;

8.verse: Who covereth the heavens with clouds,

9.verse: He giveth to the beast his food,

10.verse: He delighteth not in the strength of the horse:

11.verse: Jehovah taketh pleasure in them that fear him,

12.verse: Praise Jehovah, O Jerusalem;

13.verse: For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates;

14.verse: He maketh peace in thy borders;

15.verse: He sendeth out his commandment upon earth;

16.verse: He giveth snow like wool;

17.verse: He casteth forth his ice like morsels:

18.verse: He sendeth out his word, and melteth them:

19.verse: He showeth his word unto Jacob,

20.verse: He hath not dealt so with any nation;

1.verse: Praise ye Jehovah.

2.verse: Praise ye him, all his angels:

3.verse: Praise ye him, sun and moon:

4.verse: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens,

5.verse: Let them praise the name of Jehovah;

6.verse: He hath also established them for ever and ever:

7.verse: Praise Jehovah from the earth,

8.verse: Fire and hail, snow and vapor;

9.verse: Mountains and all hills;

10.verse: Beasts and all cattle;

11.verse: Kings of the earth and all peoples;

12.verse: Both young men and virgins;

13.verse: Let them praise the name of Jehovah;

14.verse: And he hath lifted up the horn of his people,

1.verse: Praise ye Jehovah.

2.verse: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him:

3.verse: Let them praise his name in the dance:

4.verse: For Jehovah taketh pleasure in his people:

5.verse: Let the saints exult in glory:

6.verse: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth,

7.verse: To execute vengeance upon the nations,

8.verse: To bind their kings with chains,

9.verse: To execute upon them the judgment written:

1.verse: Praise ye Jehovah.

2.verse: Praise him for his mighty acts:

3.verse: Praise him with trumpet sound:

4.verse: Praise him with timbrel and dance:

5.verse: Praise him with loud cymbals:

6.verse: Let everything that hath breath praise Jehovah.
